reviewText:
Early Access Review

Server browser and join functions still incomplete:Recent updates have partially fixed the server browser, but finding and joining games with friends is still an issue. The in game browser often won't refresh new servers. Server lists are often incomplete and have no region filtering options. There is no join IP console command. The steam friends list join function is broken. A more reliable webpage based server browser is available but it works by launching the game to join a server (which means you can't use it when the game is already running.)

Trying to get a small group of friends into the same server takes more effort than it should.

The game itself is great, and looks to be shaping up as a fine successor to Project Reality. However it currently doesn't have much content, and there's plenty of small frustrations that can kill the experience; uninterruptible animations, climbing/stamina system, buggy user placed spawns etc.

Though the worst thing right now is probably the community.
There are way too many people who try to play before learning the basic mechanics, minecrafters"

recommended: and of course with any "Milsim" game there is a fair number of junior ROTC bootlicking airsofters that are just itching to order around civillians.\n\nUnless you have a massive love for Project Reality mod

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is the game Battlefield/ARMA 3 folks have been waiting for, and it's only an Alpha.  The game draws you to play as a team, and makes you focus on objectives, rather than points/unlocks.  Big maps, vehicles on the way, and 9 slot squads are just some of the many things Squad has to offer.

Much is not complete, but for an Alpha, it's very stable.

If you are looking to play as a Squad, no pun intended, with mature people, look no further than Squad from OWI.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The most important information that I myself would have liked to have known before purchasing Squad" at its current beta build would be...

1) Without needing said; this game is entirely squad dependant... to play this game affectively
date: you need to be a team player. Likely chances of you capturing a base by yourself is nill; work together and observe the battle acitvely to take points and aid eachother with cover fire or medical aid. Medics btw
recommended: require you to first "bandage" someone once they've been shot or taken down
hoursPlayed: at which you can then proceed to using a medical bag to restore the rest of the individuals health; it is a two step process. There is also the factor
voteText: that when someone is taken down (and is no longer a threat) they are still alive and can be revived by a medic
helpfulPercent: as long as the person was not shot in the head. A medical emblem will be easily seen above those on your team who can be revived.\n\n2) Weapon Customization is limited at the current time and only few weapons are given to each squad position. There are only a few attachments for each weapon (but
votesHelpful: they are still being added with each update). The last recent update included new acogs and other attachments for select weapons; due note
votesTotal: this game does not allow you to share attachments on other weapons... Weapons
votesFunny: as well as their attachment choices are squad position dependant.\n\n3) Some squad positions (such as the sniper)
commentsCount: do not become availible for a squad choice until a given amount of members have filled a squad; this leaves the sniper position locked and unavailible until at least the 4-6 person is added. This makes it nearly impossible to attain the sniper position on purpose; getting the sniper is only likely to be availible once you've joined an active squad which is nearly full
column16: and you get lucky to see the position unused. I've always enjoyed rifles and long range sniper battles...But
column17: be warned; this game intentionally attempts to limit sniper use due to maps being very open.. this could maybe change in the future
column18: but at this time it seems to be a set feature. Snipers also use a smaller acog
column19: instead of a medium or long range scope.\n\n4) At this given time of writing this review
column20: the beta still currently does not have vehicles. Maps are very large
column21: and walking distances are beyond boring. To make it worse; your character has stamina
column22: which you must pay extra careful attention to so you can have enough to accurately aim and fire your weapon with percision when needed. When running from behind one cover to the next
column23: you will lose your stamina almost entirely. Stamina is also regained slower than most other FPS titles...; you will have to literally sit and guard your position until you can continue running. Is it realistic? Maybe... But in real life
column24: there is also troop transports and humvees... Which for both
column25: Squad devs have clearly shown pictures and videos displaying humvess and transports which are in the mix for future updates. Right now though
column27: so be warned.\n\n5) To spawn at any other location which does not include a captured enemies FOB
column28: the squad leader must (with the proximity of other squad mates) create a spawn FOB or rally point so you don't have to walk all the way from base to the next objective. To create a FOB or rally point
column29: squad mates from your squad must collect on the squad leader to allow the placement of such equipment (essentially a rallypoint looks like 3 bags placed on the ground
column30: and a FOB looks like a radio on a table); these are usually meant to be placed in a building or location that you can then build fortifications to protect the FOB spawn point. If an enemy squad/team over runs/takes/captures the FOB
column31: they can then continue to use the FOB as an enemy spawn location. FOBs
column32: can also be destroyed with explosives ect..\n\n6) Building is reserved to only certain locations
column33: which are usually small compounds centered near or around objectives. Once you walk into or around the vicinity of the compound
column34: a given amount of "construction points" are displayed in the top left of the screen. The points are used by squad leaders to build sandbag walls
column35: barbwire fences ect. Once a squad leader places a fortification
column36: it must then be built by other squad members using the "shovel" tool. A whole compound can be fortified leaving all windows and entrances blocked by choice of the squad leaders; anywhere within or directly near the compound
column37: fortifications can be built. Construction points are shared between all squad leaders
column38: so it is important to be smart with placement of items... It should be obvious
column39: but if you place a sandbag wall infront of a window
column40: try not to leave any cracks between the sandbag wall and the window itself... enemies will use said cracks in the fortification to wreck everyone within the compound... It should be remembered
column41: as its easy to know; if you can see out
column42: then the enemy can see in.\n\n7) As squad leader
column43: you must be helpful to your squad by way of communication; since FOBs and rallypoints can only be placed by squad leaders
column44: it is imperative that squad communication is present; less so by other squad members
column45: but it is absolutely necessary for the captain of the squad as he conducts the progression of the game. Without rallypoints or FOBs placed
column46: the game quickly turns into a walking simulator for all other players and it guarantees a loss when the other team is using such tools accurately. Again
column47: this game is "squad/team" dependant; you must be team player. Which to mention
column48: the community seems at this time
column49: to be far from Toxic; players work together and with a proper team (even without vehicles) the game can be quite enjoyable.\n\n8) The game runs at 50-60 Frames for myself
column50: and most if not all settings are set to max. Frames in game
column51: are entirely dependant on the quality of the server being played
column52: as well as the current or allowed population. If I were to play a max 40 player match
column53: I can maintain the 50-60 FPS no problem; but if I join a 65+ man server
column54: I get about 30-40 frames tops.\nBecause I didn't read it anywhere
column55: and didn't realize until after I purchased the game
column56: it should also be known that the 100 player servers as advertised have yet to be added to the game; most likely due to the fact that smaller servers are already having difficulty with frames
column57: ping ect... With the fact that most servers provide low FPS with higher player count; most servers to me at least
column58: are simply unplayable due to high ping or FPS instablity; this has left my server choices rather limited if I choose to play with the best experience. Just to say
column59: in case people are wondering; I have a 4GB GTX 970
column61: 12GB ddr3 and I play at a resolution of 1080p.\n\n9) The major hangups I have with the game at this current time
column62: which I believe is hindering it from becoming perfect
column63: is primarily the lack of vehicles... Running the long distances sucks terribly
column65: you'll probably learn to hate your stamina; not only because you're always waiting for it to refill
column66: but because it takes nothing to deplete it; which means about 75% of your game time
column67: is spent hunkered down in the bushes waiting for your bar to fill. I'm sure this is a tactic by devs to force players to linger in the bush intentionally instead of simply rushing objectives nonstop
column68: or is a way to force squad leaders to always be aware of placing FOBs or rallyponts; either way
column69: I very much despise it. Personally
column70: I believe at the games current beta build
column71: stamina should be increased for the enjoyment of the game; that is until vehicles are added.\n\n- Now
column72: I completely accept that this game is very early beta
column73: but considering the results of other Steam betas which eventually slowed and nearly stopped with worthwhile updates; I review my games as if they are not to recieve another update and are standalone... Yeah
column74: I'm talking to you Ark Survival... You can keep adding different dinos
column75: but you can't fix your 10 FPS code?.. Shysters."

So I searched up if others were having the same issue and found this.

http://forums.joinsquad.com/topic/11408-possible-workaround-for-voip-stutterlag-help-needed-testing/

After applying this fix to my game it runs great on my AMD fx 6300 and the game is great fun. Maps are very large and offer great replay value as there is so many ways to go about the objectives. The gun play is the most realistic I've experienced and takes getting used to. When working with a team with high communication levels your pretty much unstoppable. Just had the best 45 minutes of my life (which felt like 6 minutes) our squad leader had us set up a FOB on a hill to fire into the town we were taking and we sat there witch grenade launchers and LMG's firing into the town. I was the medic so I was busy healing dead people with my magic and watching RPG's round hit out sand bags and people scream at each other. They got the best of us and pushed up they threw a few grenades all at once and they exploded before we knew what hit us. reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is pure gold, when the server DOESNT crash, when the fps DOESNT dip and when squad DOES speak.
The weak servers will be revolved eventually, so will the fps once they have optimized it better.
So far ive been in amazing squads! 9 people communicating perfecly, shouting cool coms and helping eachother! ive never seen such teamwork as i have seen in the little hours i have in this game.
But im afraid the quality of squads will go down, the more people get this game, even now 1/3 of every squad is filled with either 12 year old thinking this is lone-wolf-cod, or people just refusing to communicate!

This game is one of those games that you either need 9 friends to secure that your playtime will be pleasant, ive already seen clans and teams building up, asking for recruits!

I have very high hopes for this game! this game is made for people that love insurgency, but think their maps are to small, and for people that love arma, but hate how complicated it is. this is right in the middle of these 2 games! and i cant wait to see what this game will turn up to be!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Even though this is a great game, their is still a lot of work to be done. heres a few examples.

we need server filters, which include region, how many players, game modes etc

their are still many bugs including sound going off and servers being full when the server browser is telling you that their are 10 slots available.

a better training mode, the current training mode just tells you how to spawn it doesnt take you through different objectives that the game throws at you.

also my rig is running an I7 4790k and a GTX980 with 16GB ram and the game doen't feel like it's optimized as good as it should be as be.

more standard weapons need to have the option to add a 4x maginification scope as many 1x scopes and iron sights are vertually useless medium to long range.

i would also like to see a option where the squad leader can tag enemy postions on your map. (last known postition)

one thing that these developers have got right is that this game is unlike any other FPS. It is heavily team based and none of this run and gun shizz. Automatic fire has next to real life weapon recoil and i find extremly hard to control the rifles and lmg's when using automatic fire.

from what i have played so far Squad is unique and has bags of potential to be one of the greatest tactical shooters ever made. I look forward to see what Squad has to offer and how it developes of the coming year.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

i've been playing squad since the first day of the closed alpha (squad leader tier)
and i can say that those $70 were the best investment i've made this year when it comes to games.

if you like hardcore fps games , with alot of communication . this is your game.
in squad you won't see any of that fast phased matchs like in cod , bf , cs .
this game require just 2 things : Have a mic , Follow orders .
those two are the key to win in this game.

a little more about this game :  yes the game is still on alpha and yes there are still bugs in the game, the experience is amazing.  if it's the sounds in the game (Wind on top of the hills , the water , the guns , explosions)
or is it the gameplay itself (firefights , sneaking and flanking)
as soon as you get into the game , you're hooked , starting to yell locations and orders around like crazy.
this is what it's all about.

right now the game is infantry only , vehicles are coming soon!
worth to stay tuned.


me and the redcoats will be happy to see you on our servers!
join the battle!


for more info on the game , gameplay or updates, just join the squad forums at : http://forums.joinsquad.com/

Early Access Review

This game is really good for those who are tired of arcade games that pretend to be fps (like Battlefield and CoD). Even in its Early Development, the gameplay is pretty decent and the company is working hard to make new features, like vehicles. But there are still some things to fix.

If you are a Battlefield or CoD player, don't buy it, unless you are willing to spend some time learning the mechanics of a real fight. The combat in Squad is intense and difficult. The weapon ballistics are the closest to reality I've ever seen in a game.

Also, the players have a unique style of fighting in groups, thing I've rarely seen in other games.

10/10 :)

Early Access Review

It may seem a little limited on the outside because it's still in Alpha development stage, but once you get into this game you will notice it's already got so many of the same mechanics that Project Reality had and more. They improved alot of the things I was annoyed by in the original PR Mod and fixed it here. Ofcourse there needs to be a lot of work done, but then again, its Alpha stage. The Humvees and Emplacements like 50 cal pillboxes etc will be added this month and make the game much more versatile. Squad brings the best world of fast paced games like Counter Strike and Insurgency together with war simulators like PR and ARMA. It's up to date, in graphics and in gameplay.

You will not regret buying it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Where to start? Sure, there are plenty of Multiplayer 1st Person shooters. Plenty of them are built in Unreal engine.

But this one has a legacy, and that legacy is Project Reality.

That's not to say that this will end up -being- Project Reality, so if you're looking for a direct, updated 1:1 match, this hasn't gotten there yet. But it is framed and inspired by PR at its core by Communications and Teamwork being the focus and most significant components of the gameplay.

In the (relatively) short amount of time since the Kickstarter concluded, this game has seen a lot of iteration and dedication put into getting things just right, in proving out the framework and all the elements that have gone into the game in order to make it possible for it to survive and be expanded upon and more importantly, for it to remain fun and engaging for the player.

There is still a lot of work left to be done: there will be bugs, hurdles, stumbles and changes. I look forward to seeing all of you on the battlefield and being a part of your Squad.


Discolsure:
Ranger level Kickstarter backer, external QA Tester group member.
I am not affiliated with nor employed by Offworld Industries (at the time of this review).
My opinions and statements are mine alone and do not reflect Offworld Industries or associated.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Squad is a spiritual successor to the Project Reality mod for Battlefield 2. I have been following its progress for years now, and I am amazed of what the devs have accomplished so far. Squad is not as mature as Project Reality mod is right now, but it offers a much better engine that will allow for much more than the 10 year old BF2 engine could handle.

The current alpha is very playable. In just 2 hours of playtime, I've been in some intense and amazing firefights. The sound design is something to be commended as well. The gunfire and explosions really immerse you in the battlefield. Communication is key in this game. If you don't speak up or have a mic, you'll be missing out on the most important gameplay element of Squad, teamplay. This game is the anti-run&gun and lone wolf FPS. If you're alone, not looking for your Squadmates, you're playing it all wrong.

Highly recommended! Even though this game is still in Early Access, the development is fast and the game features very intense infantry battles already. With the upcoming vehicles and helicopters the game will expand to larger scale combined warfare matches.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The clue is in the title, this game isn't about you, it's all about the SQUAD. You're part of a well oiled machine, teamwork and communication will win the day. So grab a mic and get ready to do your bit.

Remember this is early access so half the planned features are missing but it's core gameplay is down pat and is already an intense experience. If you want to get the most out of SQUAD join the game, join a squad and listen to your Squad Leader, he's there to help you and vice versa. He will be your guiding hand and you will be his weapon.

Being Early Access and Alpha, there are naturally some performance gripes but remember, the game is running in Unreal with very large maps and large numbers of players, things will get better but for the meantime just fiddle with your settings and check the forums or subreddit. All us backers are here to help and so are the devs, they've been releasing daily hotfixes in preparation for the EA launch and even finding time to play with us plebs so remember this is a small indie team before you go off the wall and post something silly.

So, if you miss BF2 and the good ole days before ranking and unlocks where teamplay and objectives were the be all and end all, Squad is for you. Enlist soldier!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So this game isn't without it's glitches and bad framerates in places. But honestly, what game in early access can boast solid shooter mechanics and decent netcode, as well as awesome sound design and a pretty awesome budding community?

Not many that is for sure.

Now don't get me wrong, this game isn't for your average COD dudebro, although it does resemble battlefield in some respects, partially with it's spawning system and map design, however the scale of the maps is astounding and the scale is due to increase, with the addition of vehicles!

From a none-biased point of view (I never played project reality) I can tell you, this game has great potential, in patch 3.7 they fixed most of the netcode issues that everyone was having.

As I said this game is in early alpha, not much in this game is perfect yet. But with the right amount of love and care, this game could be huge.

Also, if you would like a taste of what PTSD is like, play this game and get ambushed, this will mess you up!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First play only lasted about 20 minutes... but in that time my squad and I managed to clearout a stronghold and then continue to advance. I lead the advance... and as I lay on a hill crawling towards enemy fire I see a grenade go overhead and land somewhere behind me. Before I had a chance to react I was hit with shrapnel. My ears ringing, my vision blurred, I managed to bandage myself well enough to pull the pin on a grenade of my own and heave it back in their direction. That frag took out a handful of those ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s... As I stood up to crest the hill everything went black... (...lost connection to server... DAMNIT!)

So far so good. Easily one of the most thrilling tactical shooter experiences I've had in a long long time.

9/10 - Would take a grenade in the back and d/c again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Strikes the perfect balance between Mil-Sim and Mainstream FPS, requires teamwork and mic to really enjoy the game. If you don't work as a team and communicate effectively you're going to have a bad time. There is a learning curve, and don't count on seeing the enemy, understanding fire superiority is key to push forward as a squad. Learning how to squad lead effectively is extremely rewarding, nothing is better than getting your guys in perfect ambush position and holding fire until they get out in the open......sweet sweet endorphine rush.

Still quite a few kinks to work through with optimization and anti-cheat, but if you're rig exceeds the recommended specs you should be good to go. Think of it as an infantry only version of Project Reality at this time. The game and the graphics engine are both in early development so this one should really take off in a year, the community is pretty healthy as you need to use teamwork to win. The learning curve is steep, but once you figure it all out it's hard to play anything else.

Tip: Currently Set Shadows to Low (not shadow detail), memory leak or something on that setting and it doesn't really make a difference visually but you'll get back your framerate.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ya know, this game is really refreshing. It requires so much more skill both for the individual and team than most other shooters i have seen recently. All the communication and cooperation of squads are vital and have proved to greatly immerse the player into the environment and gameplay. Though winning and losing doesn't give any achievements or hurt the player's reputation in any way, you feel a real sense of responsibility to your teammates to do well and to have the best plan. This response may be due to the fact that we can hear eachothers voices which really creates a sense of community and brotherhood. I know this is an early access game, but i thought i should already state how much i have enjoyed my time playing this game and i can really say that i really look forward to the future this game holds.

some suggestions:
-a fix for the grenader launching sight-aim for the AKs would also be nice, kind of janky right now.
-a kill feed would also be nice to know if you killed an enemy, BUT i sort of like not knowing because in reality, who would unless you were standing over their body for sure?
- oh! it would also be cool if you could grab a downed teammates body (maybe over the shoulder or dragging) and run with it to cover (suggested by medic here :D).
*any others if i think of them i will post in an update of my review.

Edit 03/22/2016:
-after playing a while and encouraging my friends to buy the game, i found that an in game party" would greatly improve the user ability to organize a group of friends together. Also be able to see the matches your friends are currently in so you can join that match.
* i can still say that this game has been a pleasure and with all the new updates it has just gotten more dynamic and better overall"
voteText: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Having played about 6 games in total (1 hour long) I noticed that I've engaged the enemy about 10-20% of the time during each match. The rest of the time is spent hunkering down with the squad leader and the team prepping for the next objective, moving forward cautiously and looking for movement in the distance, setting up FOBS and defences in strategic locations and discussing all the possibilities and outcomes of what could happen in the next 30 seconds, every 30 seconds.

When the squad I'm in starts opening fire, I get a buzz.

You spend most of the game preparing for enemy engagements, most of the game is spent tensing yourself up and you experience a lot of anxiety. Then when you start engaging, it's almost like a relief.

I love the gunshots in the distance when other teams are engaging and I especially love hearing the gunshots increase in intensity when all of the sudden our squad leader tells us that Bravo team needs assistance.

Grenades make you jump and are loud enough, and their visual effects are strong enough, to momentarily stun you, especially if it wasn't expected. This moment of vulnerability can weaken even the strongest and most well-organised defence in a compound.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

At the bottom of this review contains a message to the developers regarding gameplay mechanics.
----
Squad is one of the next big military simulator based shooter games that's working through its Alpha stages. It's current build is still in test phases, yet already offers intense gameplay with an incredible amount of potential, especially since this game as a somewhat direct response to the limitations to project reality, a milsim modification.

Such a feat for a great game also lies within the community that plays it. For the most part, everyone seems to be fully immersed into the environment, a handful of maps with only a few specific locations for objectives, yet has miles and miles of details, distant houses and rolling hills, settlements and farms. This tells you immediately the ambitions of the developers and how much they want to expand this game into having enormous amounts of content in the future. The players, are able to tactfully (or not) navigate around these expansive terrains and establish forward operating bases so that other players may spawn in that location, or a rally point so your squad specifically can have a limited time to assist your squad leader.

All of these features are a direct result of player communication and teamwork. A good squad will always keep their head in the game and keep each other updated, and learn the game more. With a realistic environment and sense of danger, you are able to put yourself in a position where you play into the game’s world, making it all the more an energetic rush of adrenalin and fear.

Please don’t become Interstellar Marines, you have the potential to make this into such a great product that you guys will be sitting on mountains of cash, you probably feel that way already. The only downfall is that you guys have to stop those idiots using smoke grenade exploits and that “lost connection to host” anomaly that kicks you out of your game every so often, bordering on “occasional”.

Another qualm that I am sure will be figured out soon is a way to keep people working as a team and stop with the MLG pro counterstrike tier combat. Finally, a favorites system would be so helpful for singling out the best servers for players so they don’t have to go through server listings on the other side of the planet where ping is just nonexistent.

A serious rating from me personally? 8/10.
One point for connection problems and a few glitches, other point due to a small fraction of the community bending the direction of the approach this game is meant to have, either by not being a team player, or trolling, exploits, making fun of people that are immersed and taking it “seriously”.

Message to developers:
I've noticed something that you should consider looking into. For me, aiming isn't necessarily a problem, but when I am firing at a target at two hundred meters, moving the scope a single centimeter doesn't really have a smooth transition, it has this minor, blocky flick to the next pixel and that makes it extremely hard to get it lined up with my target. I understand that it should be difficult to aim, but this minor thing really throws me off when I am taking down targets.

It's quite unsettling to know that people have somehow mastered being able to one shot you with iron sights at that distance. Maybe I just suck, but in games like Red Orchestra 2, ARMA, etc my precision is much better, rather than having your view subtly bump with every movement, a smoother one take place for aiming. It would make a huge difference for many that really do try to legitimately line up shots rather than relying on unfounded casual shooter skills.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Whilst I only have 16 hours in Squad currently, I do have many, many hours in Insurgency and Arma 3.

Currently to really enjoy the game (IMO) completly relies on having 2 things in place,

2. Decent Inter Squad communications

With these 2 things happening then the game is fantastic, and set to get better and better. I am concerned vehicles will change things to much as the maps are big, but not that big, but lets wait to see how they are implimented.

Squad to me is a midway point between Insurgency and Arma 3.  I am very much looking forward to how it develops.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Squad is not your typical FPS. This development team started out as a community game creating a mod, simply to make the game that they wanted to play - Project Reality. Using the BF2 engine they accomplished some unbelievable things. BUT times change and that engine got old. So, fast forward to 2015 and here we are, with the Alpha release of Squad.

Already it plays better than most AAA titles. More realistic than BF4, prettier than insurgency, more accessible and less clunky than ArmA, and with more teamwork than all of those combined.

Currently it focuses on infantry combat, and does a pretty damn epic job. Within the next few weeks we will see things change massively with the introduction of vehicles to the mix. Engagement ranges will change, teamwork will improve and coordination will be needed to win. As usual the best place to play is on the tacticalgamer.com server which has a primer and ruleset established over a decade ago to get the most realistic and fun experience out of this game. They have a history in PR second to none and it looks set to continue into Squad.

Try this out - I can no recommend it enough. If you are sick of generic COD/BF games and want something more, and to really communicate and feel like you achieved something, try out Squad.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you do not have a functioning mic or unable to grasp the basic concept of teamwork, do not buy or play this game

I have played its predecessor, Project Reality, for roughly 2 year, and I can assure that this game is a mixbreed between PR and Insurgency, I highly suggest that you should play or try PR series before buying this game, because its just basically PR with good graphics.

Pros:

Good graphics, not so extreme, but its better than a BF2 engine
Well-arranged squad system, no more grabbing marksman kit and going solo, although I'm forward for the Commander position to be implemented in-game
Sound effects, I can hear my teammate's gunfire inside a building, and it echoes throughout the area
Kits, such as light machinegunner, medic, light anti-tank are limited, and you can see how many are available on the menu
It's basically PR with good graphics

Cons:

Lack of tutorial, making new players having difficulties when learning the game, the training range or video tutorials in youtube isn't enough, there should be an in-game tutorial for the basics like other FPS games
Hefty price tag, I pre-purchase it so I got it for $30, but its still expensive for an indie game
There is no knife or any melee attack option ingame, I know that this is alpha, but it seems that its a basic thing
No bots to play co-op or training
Some walls are bugged
Ping issues, I live on VA and played on NY server, got 200-300 ping
Most player I met ingame don't have mic or refuse to communicate, making the gameplay not enjoyable
8.5/10

Get a mic before you buy this game.

Protip: you might wanna wait until they update or add more content, because its really lacking

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I didn't enjoy the BF2 mod, but so far SQUAD is great, and I can't wait to see how well this game shapes in its release.

This is not a game so much about shooting things. Shooting things is important, but even if you're really good at shooting things you might not be successful in SQUAD.

SQUAD is a unique game; its about teamwork and communication - players working together as a Squad, and Squads working together as a Platoon. It is unlike anything I've ever played in that it is the first true teamwork oriented FPS, and its a great change from the typical FPS games that have flooded the market.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIn short, Squad provides an experience very similar to ARMA series without the convolution and tedium. reviewText:
Early Access Review

Though it may have some optimization kinks. It's a great Early Access game to start with, and a great military game overall. Classes seem balanced and each one is ACTUALLY IMPORTANT. Genadier, needed in a squad. Medic, very much needed. Support, very very usefull, squad leader who actually does stuff and makes choices, yes, a must. And recon classes like acog scopes or use of binoculars. YES. If you get a good squad, this game can be played for hours on end. And vehicles haven't even been added yet.

For me, what got me hooked was that it wasn't a good idea to just run in the open for once. Use cover, stay low, move as a squad (but keep spread out), check your corners, actually use your map and compass, and my favorite feature of course, squad leaders talking between eachother to plan how their team will work. A good game, and though I'd prefer the price of $30 over $40, it was a good purchase and I don't regret it.

EDIT: Still don't regret the puchase, got more than enough hours from the game to justify $40 of entertainment costs doing anything else. I did notice that my play style has changed a lot since I started playing, and that FoBs are not meant to be castles built up high in the middle of no where. To me they are now simple strategic spawn points. Support role is now useless in my mind because my guys don't use suppessing fire, we two tap and confirm. Yet the game is still a great game, with more features to come and a solid community.

This game gave me PTSD
When life doesn't match up

I have played this game so much I find it hard to coexist with my peers without proper team play! Real life is a really sh**y server and the communication is bad.
So bad in fact, that I am having nightmares about not being able to intercommunicate with the other leaders at work to coordinate an action plan!
Must consider quitting my job and selling my family to some warlord in Africa and start playing Squad full-time!
They simply can’t understand, man!
The life we live, the things we do, what we have seen…!
They can’t understand..!
I’m going back….to my brothers, the only ones that know!
Knows the horrors and strain!
The ones who knows how to build the perfect Super-FOB!
To the shoveling and bandaging, to the long range ACOG-heroes!
Back to the long and hard wait for vehicles and stationary weapons and the long, oh so long, trekking across mountains and valleys.
To the ♥♥♥♥ blyat and the Leroy Jenkins of Fools Road!

They can’t understand!
Im going back…

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Squad hits a very specific style in the FPS spectrum. And it's perfect. I bought the game back in September for $70 and I think it was worth every penny. I have nothing but positive things to say about the game. The best part is offworld's development methods. I see the devs on the forums interacting with players. There have been many times where they will ask us to go to their server to help them fix something and crash it and we will becase A lot of the squad players want this game to succede!

The comunity in this game is another great thing! They are awesome! If you are new just let your squad know and they will rush to help you and bring you up to speed. Sure there are those few bad ones that every community has but they are drowned out by the majority of great players in the game.

I will say that you 99% NEED a mic for this game. You will not be favored if you play without a mic. The rest of the team wants to communicate with you and will get upset when you don't return the favor.

All of the cons of the game will be ironed out during the development process.

Please know that you can't play this game like Battlefield or CoD. It isn't that kind of a game. The only similarities it has with those games is that Squad is an FPS. Everything else is different.

Overall 10/10 Cant wait to see what the finished product looks like.

Early Access Review

Squad the game is made by the team also worked on Project Reality mod for Battlefield 2, which is the all-time favorited realistic mod considered by most BF2 players. As a successor of such popular mod, Squad is definitely gonna be the next combat sim FPS game. Currently Squad however doesn't have as many contents as PR mod, and there's some minor issues still left in game, The dev team used to give quite great promises during the Kickstarter funding campaign, and some of them are yet to implement, which is kind of slow.

So my current suggestion is to put this game on watch list, wait for few months and see if this game is getting better.

If you insist on getting this game, maybe you should check if there's a server running at your country first. You can check the server browser in webpages here.[squad.rocks]

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Thought it about time i wrote an OPINIONATED review for Squad for myself. Now although my page states i have played 26 hours, i was part of the Pre-alpha, closed alpha and obviously am playing throughout EA so i have witnessed many changes, additions and have had the pleasure of playing with the devs so i do know quite a bit about the game/its current mechanics.

Now before reading this or any other review i do encourage you to jump over to JoinSquad.com and read the updates and forum posts because if you're thinking of buying this you should know that my opinions may have changed now because they may have updated many aspects of what i cover - it is early access afterall.

Pros

- The infantry combat is extremely good and i feel that i have the power to make a difference to an entire game/match. This is a feeling sourely missed in many games such as battlefield, Cod, some Arma mini-games. You can take out an entire squad of enemies by finding the correct positions, aiming well and then capture an objective turning the entire match around because of your back-cap of their objective.

- Teamplay is key. When i play games such as Insurgency, Battlefield, Cod, Arma (other than milsim) the feeling of being in a team or squad is just names on a list that allow me to either spawn next to speed up my chances of getting into action or maybe can heal me every now and again. Where-as Squad offers the chance to actually feel like you are part of something much bigger. Your Squad can work together to fight in a town full of enemies to capture an objective or defend a compound or even flank the enemy by traveling deep behind enemy lines. I'll always remember a Good squad leaders that split the Squad i was in, into two fireteams and set myself, a medic and two rifleman and a grenadier to go north, flank the enemy and back-cap them while the other 4 squad members defended the objective with their lives. The fight was intense, comms were perfect and we used our superior tactics and teamwork to change a losing game into a impressive victory.

- A bridge between Arma and Battlefield. Now i know many say this but i feel it is true. You have constant combat of BF (granted this is depending on map) with the tactics and realism of Arma (also dependent on squad leaders skills). My problem with battlefield is that it is too runny and gunny for me, the lack of tactics and the ease and lack fo challenge makes the game too boring for me. I have way over 1000 hours in Arma 3 and love the game. However, i love the teamplay of milsim with it but in a two hour session i'll probably walk for 2 hours and shoot some 30 enemies where-as Squad allows me to be constantly ingulfed in a warzone of action, have the teamplay i want but also provide challenge and the sense of no two games are the same.

- The promise of content and the developers - I love Project Reality and i find the fact that they have announced through both kickstarter and website the types of vehicles (at minimum) to be very promising. The developers are always busy working on this game and have released many updates (at minimum once a month in Closed alpha) and around 3-4 since release of early access. They enjoy the game as much as we do and are very dedicated to creating new content, improving user experience and performance and just making the game they want to play. My friend had a problem with turning and the sudden decrease in fps that occurred (something that didnt happen to my other 5 friends) but one of the developers was very fast in responding and helping us out and now the problem is fixed!

- Community is great, helpful and most of the Squad leaders know what they are doing and are always happy to receive new players who wish to take part in the squad, follow the leaders instructions and learn how to properly play the game.

Cons

- The Price for current content is quite high. I do not disagree with the price personally but many of my friends think it is high especially for an 'early access' game which seems to be the 'done thing' of starting cheap and raising price closer to release however, i'd much rather put £30 into a game now and get the features i want promised and delivered than put £10 into a game and have the developers and myself thinking well they only put £10 into the game so i can take my time. Squad is not a 'cheap' game but if anything this encourages myself to actively support and contribute to the community and also help the developers to be  able to afford more team members and keep them motivated to carry on creating a game i love.

- Some performance issues in both Server and client. The game will run buttersmooth 60fps+ on ultra preset for me if im in a a good server with 50-60 people in however, if the map is on Kohat (one of the larger maps) with 70+ players my performance goes to below 30fps and i do not think i have a 'bad' pc (I7 4790k, r9 390x). With their last update i gained 10fps though so this is DEFINITELY just because its new and some-what unoptimised (or rather not as optimised as it could be).

-  Some of the players (usually newer players) are treating the game as if it is Call of duty with the solo 'run and gun' type mindset. This would be ok if they didnt join a squad, take the only available sniper role and then run 2km away from the squad to then die and lose tickets for the team. This is bound to happen in anygame but just be aware that Squad leaders can and will kick you if you misbehave, do not contribute towards the squad or mess aroun when theyre trying to play tactically.

- Hackers, although i have not experienced many in-game i have experienced a few. One was killing people who spawned in at the start of the game and another was screaming 'Allah huecbar' and 'Alan Snackbar' while somehow dropping explosions around the map. This will be hopefully fixed soon due to the change-over to what i believe is EAC - easy anti-cheat i believe but could be wrong. But be assured its in the devs top priority list along with vehicles and performance.

One of the major compelling parts of PR for me was the cross of air, infantry and ground units/vehicles and this is sorely missed in Squad at the minute but its EA and they have promised to give us what we and they want!

Overall opinion:
Overall i'd give the current game 7.5/10 for infantry combat, fun aspect and teamwork and promised features assuming they are like PR's. However when new maps, vehicles and performance increases i feel this game will easily surpass to the 9/10.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

---Honestly I might recommended this in it's current state without the vehicles. I'll probably update this comment for when they add them and in other notable updates.---

Squad is a semi-realistic game made by some of the people who helped make the Project Reality mod for BF2. Squad is a game that balances realism and arcade and is teamwork centric. Some of the things it features include: constructing FOBs (spawnpoint/base with optional defenses), combined arms and asymmetric warfare (when they add vehicles), realistic depictions of nation's uniforms, gear and equipment and PTSD.

Also if you've played and enjoyed games such as Insurgency, Rainbow Six series, ARMA series, Red Orchestra series, and many other notable games you're guaranteed to enjoy. Also I recommend Project Reality, it's still going strong as a great game and is now downloadable without BF2.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Written at 12/10/2015, five days before early access to public.

Before I start, I just wanted to tell you that the predecessor of Squad is a mod based on Battlefield 2 called Project Reality, it features ground combined arms combat, aerial warfare which includes helicopter and jets, and small portion of naval warfare. The overall ideology of this mod is to create a team-based tactical shooter game that looking towards to some degree of realism. I'm not gonna talk too much about PR here, this is just a peek on where Squad is heading to.

So let us go back to Squad. So far Squad only features infantry combat, ground light vehicles will be available within most likely a month, so my review will only focus on the infantry combat for now.

This game is all about tactical cooperation and sticking together as a SQUAD while obeying orders from your squad leader. It goes so far that not only it encourages you to stay with the squad, you will get penalites from being a lone wolf.

For example, not join a squad will limit your select-able kit to basic rifleman,  dynamic role limitation system(or whatever it's actually called) allows you to choose from more kits progressively if certain number of players is in your squad and your team, and if you decided to go for getting the kits you want from other squad and quit then good for you, because the game will take away your kit at the moment you left and re-assign you with a recruit" kit with the ammo you left before you quit the squad. Without a squad you can easily get pinned down and killed from enemy gun fire while no one can help you out.

This game binds players together so tie that even you don't know each other you can still play as a squad and win the game easily

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As much as I love the gunplay and the game itself, I cannot tell anyone they would have a fun time because of one reason alone.

At the release of the game on steam, the devs made the most foolish decision: Telling the entire community that they have no anti-cheat system in place. There are plenty of free, effective, functional anticheat systems; there is no reason it shouldn't be in place.

I do not know if they have fixed this, but the game is full of hackers. I'm not kidding. Full of them. The most favorite hack is infinite ammo, auto firing, grenade launchers. Whether it be to spam smokes to crash servers, or HE to kill people, the game is ridden with hackers.

The game itself is fun, but the devs screwed the community over with 1) not implimenting an anticheat program as part of their core game functionality 2) telling everyone they have not implimented an anticheat program as part of their core game functionality.

As much hype as I had, this game is not worth the frustration of not being able to play the game without at least one person hacking in the server. It's awful... I wanted to really enjoy this.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

In its early state, there definitely are some kinks that need to be worked out. Gamebreaking bugs. Non-gamebreaking bugs. Balance issues. Etc.

But if you're able to look past those things in its alpha state, it's actually quite enjoyable, especially when you have a team that works together and isn't toxic. And to ensure that you aren't one of those players, make sure you read the user manual, even if it's just a skim through. A basic knowledge of how objectives work on different game modes, and how each others classes work can really make or break a team. The rest comes from experience. Be it knowing when to hunker down and hold the line, break contact, or take a more aggressive approach.

Once you have those key elements down though, it's easy to have fun with it. One team suppresses while the other flanks around. Defending an objective from enemy forces. All of it has its fun, even if you're on the losing side. Most games tend to be close, anyway, cutting it within a few tickets each.

At the end of the day, with the constant updates to the game, and with unreal's engine still being in its baby stages, this game hold a lot of potential.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a fine example of Early Access done right!

As it stands, the game is fun and engaging with just the right blend of realism and playabillity. It doesn't wander into ARMA need to memorize 700 key combos territory where you have a three button combo to wipe your goggles (I'm not ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥tting, its in there) but it also stays well away from the dopey run-and-gun which most FPS has decayed into.

Frankly, the best way I can describe it is that it kind of feels like you took the gameplay feel of old-school Tom Clancy (Think Rouge Spear era Rainbow Six) and scaled it up massively and dropped it into a surprisingly well crafted outdoor enviroment.

The UE4 Engine shines here, and I can only imagine where this is going to go as more features are added down the line.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSquad is the spiritual successor to the critically acclaimed Project Reality mod for Battlefield 2. The game focuses predominantly on team based player versus player combat. To encourage teamwork, the game modes are heavily objective  based, such as taking objectives or destroying caches. Also, it includes a positional VoIP system to simulate radio and local chatter, as well as roles like Medic and Rifleman. While only in Early access, the game already offers a lot of good fun with both your friends and strangers! Later they'll be adding in more factions, maps, vehicles, etc. Overall, if you like games like ArmA and Insurgency, I would recommend picking this up!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Overall the game is pretty solid, for a eailer release game. You can really play throught it and enjoy yourself. My main issue was the lag spikes but with the newest christmas eve patch they seem to have fixed that.

Pros: Sounds are A++ one of the best sound packages for any FPS on the market. The noise of the round cracking when it gets close to your head, or when other players are shooting around you sounds extremely authentic. Even when you shoot inside a room, the sound changes pitch.

Weapons calibration seems pretty dead on, US military trains to hit targets up to 300 meters away, most engagements in game are any where between 25 and 150 meters which brings into account accuracy.

Realism, Round count is key since you don't have a counter on your HUD, reloading is also a manual task when your magazine is empty as it is in real life.

Teamwork is everything, you can get massive kills and still maintain the same score if killing the enemy isnt nesscary to the mission.

Cons:
The most annoying part of the game wasn't the game itself, it was finding a server to play the game on. I wanted the full experience with the most number of players as possible, But, I also wanted the low FPS that I know I can handle, the problem was, not enough servers of my choosing,

It would be nice if there was a auto join feater on top of the manual choosing server to facilitate with finding the best server for you.

Maybe a dedicated section for Squads to train, I understand there is a training map but maybe a area where squads can work on military battle drills.

More specifc roles in the squd, The ability to have teamleaders would help out immensely at Base construction and would also take the place of squad leader when the SL falls.

better mapping system, using a military style MLGS grid system similar to ARMA 3 lay out would make it easier in identifying targets


All and all its a great game and in a year time this game will be more polished and will only get better.

Early Access Review

Despite the low amount of time shown on my profile, I was playing this game back when it was in closed Alpha.

The game has been coming along amazingly, and since they added a whole bunch of new servers and the game became available on Steam then it has gone from strength to strength. Every itteration improves performance, weapons, and general gameplay.
The gameplay is smooth, but there have been some people confused about the specs needed. AMD seems to suffer slightly with the game. The occasional kick also happens, but you need to be aware that it IS EARLY ACCESS.
Saying that though, I have had such an amazing experience in this game. It is one of the most polished, playable and exciting Early Access games that I have played in a hell of a long time on Steam. If you enjoy your military simulators, then I recommend giving this a try. Don't be confused and think it is Arma or Battlefield, but think of Grown Up Battlefield 3, with actual communication and strategy, compound clearing excitement and hitboxes which work. All in all, an absolutely solid effort from Offworld, and a briliant advance from Project Reality.

Communication is key, play with a mic, get to know your squad, listen to squad leaders commands and work as a team and there in is where the game shines. Callout enemies,  move as a unit, attack as one, conquer as a squad.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Absolutely fantastic. This game almost perfectly fills the whole I had from the arma missions I used to play with a group. The advantage this has over Arma is it is all in one easy to access focused package. Also, it runs a hell of a lot better.

The only real problem I have is that games can be inconsistent, and how enjoyable a match is for you largely relies on your teammates. So far though, I usually get pretty decent groupings.

One bit of advice I'll chuck out to people who aren't used to proper milsim type combat is, SPREAD THE ♥♥♥♥ OUT. Too many times I see entire squads being supressed by single LMGs, or 4-5 people blown up by 1 grenade. Spreading out also comes with the advantage of making it harder for you to be flanked. It's good to work together as a team, but that doesn't mean you have to all be holding each others hands, try to keep atleast 3-4 meters between you and other teammates. If that means missing out on shooting at people the rest of your squad is, then good. This game isn't about kills, your better off covering sectors other people aren't than trying to shoot at the ones other people already are. The only time this doesn't really apply, is when you are stacking against a wall to breach a doorway or opening.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSquad is the spiritual successor to the critically acclaimed Project Reality mod for Battlefield 2. The game focuses predominantly on team based player versus player combat. To encourage teamwork, the game modes are heavily objective  based, such as taking objectives or destroying caches. Also, it includes a positional VoIP system to simulate radio and local chatter, as well as roles like Medic and Rifleman. While only in Early access, the game already offers a lot of good fun with both your friends and strangers! Later they'll be adding in more factions, maps, vehicles, etc. Overall, if you like games like ArmA and Insurgency, I would recommend picking this up!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has the perfect balance between creative license and true to life gameplay, It is very rewarding if you(and your team) play it right but also very punishing all the way from a team level to an indivdual level. Everyone contributes and effect the outcome of the game but you can not do it alone. so far one of the best shooters ever made, thanks to the near decade long effort of the developers on project reality. Now with the limitations removed from modding an old game with out support to using the latest of the latest in gaming engines to provide us as consumers the best playing experience.


- [TAW] Zlipnit

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a fine example of Early Access done right!

As it stands, the game is fun and engaging with just the right blend of realism and playabillity. It doesn't wander into ARMA need to memorize 700 key combos territory where you have a three button combo to wipe your goggles (I'm not ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥tting, its in there) but it also stays well away from the dopey run-and-gun which most FPS has decayed into.

Frankly, the best way I can describe it is that it kind of feels like you took the gameplay feel of old-school Tom Clancy (Think Rouge Spear era Rainbow Six) and scaled it up massively and dropped it into a surprisingly well crafted outdoor enviroment.

The UE4 Engine shines here, and I can only imagine where this is going to go as more features are added down the line.

voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Love this game. It's early access but worth every penny.

The devs include a bulk of the original Project Reality team and they seem to be growing in the right way. It's very obvious this team knows what they're doing.

Ages ago, I played PR and no FPS game has since given me such an amazing experience. It looks like Squad will offer the same great gameplay and more -- it hits all the right marks so far for a realism-oriented, tactical FPS.

I'm looking forward to more maps / kits / vehicles / etc. The dev team is giving progress updates every month, all of which so far have been very honest and informative. They're clearly very passionate about releasing high quality software, well rounded maps, well designed/animated components, etc.

This is a game I see myself playing for a long, long time! Like Project Reality, I expect the community to be around for a while as well.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

9/10- amaziiinngggg game so far

so, me and my squad were running through the dessert, comms were quiet and distance gun shots could be heard from the south east, we was planning on taking the 3rd flag and then meeting up with squad 1 to take the 4th.. we stopped and squatted down to check our maps and put a rally point ( where your squad can spwan) down. we was all chatting about where to move then all of a sudden, a distant voice could be heard... we all looked at the direction it was coming from and we could just see, a team member, running through the dessert with a RGP singing the A team music, we all watched as he jogged by. we watched in total silence. as soon as he ran out of hearing distance we see him accidently fire his rpg into the floor and blow himself up...

from me and my squad, I salute you.

but nah seriously, a good game, I can run it on my super bad pc (with low graphics of course but still) it runs smoothly but the only issue would be the ping and internet speeds. my ping never seems to go below 50 on a populated server, my tip to you Is fine a server that says 'UK' or 'FR' or 'US depending where you are with only 1 or 2 people on it, your ping should be low, not too many people to annoy you and people will steadily start to join more

But i know how to recognize a good game. and this is one of those.
While having some issues due to being an Alpha...The game play is solid, the gunplay is magnificent, and the feeling...oh boy the feeling...

My first match was on some sort of Afghanistanish enviroment, i jumped in and said hi to my squad. Instantly most of members replied (t'was the start of the match). reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSquad is the game I have been waiting for since Red Orchestra 2 was such a disappointment to me. This game falls between Insurgency and ARMA. It strikes the right balance for a game to be realistic but not clucky and unfun. Yes is is an Early Access and cost more than most but I have been following the development for over a year and they have hit every target publicly set. Squad already has a solid foundation for future updates and hopefully some mods. If you are looking for something more realistic with team communication this is the game and I don’t see anything coming close for a long time.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI like the game, it has great potential, amazing graphics and sounds helps you feel the realistic imersion. I love the communication and team play aspect of the game, that being one of the main reasons I bought it. It is still in alpha so many things need to be added and fine tuned. Some of the negatives, no vehicles in game yet, only 3 fractions that are playable as of now. It has not been optimized yet so fps drops all around for even decent gaming rigs. There are cheaters in this game that run freely, in the almost 60 hours i have online, ive run into at least 10 instances of guys using some kind of aiming cheat or auto grenade launchers, there needs to be active admins and people banning these cheaters. If the company needs more money to manage these ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s and to speed up the process of added content, i would be and many more in the community would be more than willing to donate more money to speed things up. Over all for the price, even though its not a completed game, I think it is worth the money and deff playable as of now, id give the game as of now in alpha phase 7.5/10, with a great possibility of it being a solid 10/10 if they deliver on their promises

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nWarning to all people with Msi Motherboards who use Atheros Killer Network Manager do not buy this game it will not run multiplayer untill you take away that network adapter driver!!! on the other hand this game is throroughly enjoyable 50 v 50 servers with maps that extend as far as the eye can see. The main con i see with this game is the price, 40 dollars seems a bit steep to many people and i frankly don't blame them, a more preferable price would be around 30 dollars but still a fasts paced exhilerating experience not for any casual gamer.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSquad is the game I have been waiting for since Red Orchestra 2 was such a disappointment to me. This game falls between Insurgency and ARMA. It strikes the right balance for a game to be realistic but not clucky and unfun. Yes is is an Early Access and cost more than most but I have been following the development for over a year and they have hit every target publicly set. Squad already has a solid foundation for future updates and hopefully some mods. If you are looking for something more realistic with team communication this is the game and I don’t see anything coming close for a long time.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is very promising!
Pretty much anyone who enjoys games such as Arma, maybe even Insurgency are going to find a lot of fun in this game.
+ Great sounds
+ Good gunplay
+ maps are decent (could use more variety obviously ^^)
+ Once you actually get into a good match with nice squad the game works fine (for the most part) and is rly enjoyable.

However !! BEFORE YOU BUY !! you should prepare to face these issues CONSTANTLY:

-Terrible pings on servers ranging from +100 all the way to even 500 (playing from EU in EU servers.)
- Occasional disconnects.
- !!! Insane load times!!! (note bellow)
- This game can completely wreck your pc ESPECIALLY during load times.
(I have had scenarios where i cant rly do much on the pc before restarting it after playing this game.)
- Prepare to struggle finding a server if you plan to play with your friends. Aim for +15 open spots on a server (depending how many friends you have with you to make it through load times before the slots are filled. (if the open spots on the server do get filled you will load forever and then get told ''server is full'')
- You can't que to a server or join as a group.

For some These problems may sound minor but constantly wrestling with the game can and will rly put down the mood for playing the game.
Concider maybe waiting for the game to get a bit more content / some patching before jumping in.

Other notes: Make sure you have a working microphone to fully enjoy this game. (allso get lucky to find a squad / team / server where other ppl have working michophones.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So far it is everything Project Reality was as far as game play and teamwork, but on a much more beautiful engine.

+ In Depth, realistic large battlefields, with realistic terrain.
+ Beautiful graphics brings the realistic terrain to life.
+ Use the environment, to find the best shooting position.
+ Much more intense, if your willing to be patient and tactical with your kills.
+ In game local/squad/command chat options work perfect, teamplay is great.
+ Realistic injury and medic system
+ Good balance of classes, support/sniper/different rifle men/AT riflemen/squad leaders etc.

It took a little adaption from Project Reality. certainly a bit more difficult to spot targets in this more realistic environment.

The early access price, is the full game price. So if your not ready to play an Alpha, then I wouldn't buy it yet. There is bugs, and a lot of content to come yet.

Also I would recommend having the recommended system requirements, not the minimum. Although if it doesn't work, you can refund the game in under two hours of gameplay with no hassal.

The only negative is, it is a Early Access, and we all need to wait for more brilliant content. But so far I have found it a lot less buggy then Full Releases by publishers such as Electronic Arts have done in the past.

Oh yeah, currently there is too many maps with Americans in, we need some other sides, British would be great. You know because you have to attract the average joe by putting America as the first army, like every other shooter over the last 10 years.

See you on the battlefield.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Hiking / Misery simulator. 9/10 Would hike and die again.

Seriously though it's solid for EA. First 3 hours were torture. Pretty sure I got zero kills (the scoring was confusing at first) and may not have even gotten a round within 50 meters of anyone.  A lot of spray and pray and die. Remarkably my teammates were helpful and never got on me for being a newb. Also amazingly not a single one ever ***** my mother or wanted me to eat ***** and die. (good people)

Somewhere around the 3rd hour after a lot of help from various squad mates I finally figured out the basic process of maneuvering on targets. I got my first confirmed kill following a squad leader into a castle ruin compound. We went around a corner and he cleared left as I swept right to see the enemy on the second floor of the ruins just as he noticed me. He raised his weapon and it was almost as if I could see the terror in his eyes as he realized he wouldn't be quick enough. On this 3rd hour the kill was mine. I calmly clicked the mouse 3 times and put 3 shots center mass and watched as he crumpled to the floor.

Good kill bud
date: you saved my 6 on that one
recommended:
crackled over the radio from my squad leader. My heart was pounding and in that moment I realized that one kill felt better than any killstreak or combo I have ever achieved in any other game. All the misery and hike'n'dies were worth it. Team work is the ultimate payoff in this game. Sometimes you get the kill and sometimes your squad mate saves your butt, however both are just as satisfying. (but mostly you will die a lot, so deal with it nancy!)

Long story short, support this idea and buy the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Squad has good potential to become one of the best tactical shooters out there. The gunplay is on point and the teamwork fundamentals are there, but there is still something lacking.

For one, the game is unoptimized in its current state. That's forgivable given its alpha status but optimization should be something that must be fixed. By optimization, I don't mean framerate issues as I've had none. However, the game's graphics seem to be a bit funky; on lowest settings, everything seems to be pixelated past a certain distance which makes seeing enemies from long distances a difficult task. I remember getting shot from a hill but I was unable to spot the people firing due to the pixelization.

The game itself also lacks features in its current state. There are no vehicles which means traversing the map can be tedious and time-consuming. I'm not complaining as I'm all for realism but I wanted to let you know, the consumer, what you're getting with this version of the game.

Teamwork is great. I love hearing my teammates organizing a plan of attack because it really immerses me into the game. Everyone seems to be mature which is good to know. The less-patient players seem to be very few in this game which makes it all the better. Of course, don't expect every squad to be well organized as there are, as in every game, d-bags who try to ruin the game for everyone. If you're matched with people publicly, expect the worst.

Gunplay itself is wonderful. The guns sound amazing; they have the impact and crunch you'd expect from a gun. Bullets drop realistically and taking fire from weapons adds chromatic abrasion to your screen to simulate PTSD. You can switch from automatic to semi-automatic modes on your rifles.

Long story short: if you like infantry-based combat with a heavy emphasis on teamwork, get this game. Be mindful that you may never fire your weapon before dying and that dying costs your team tickets (which, when it gets to 0, causes your team to lose). If you prefer an action-packed shooter, skip this title. Not much action to be had...yet.

Rating for this alpha: 7/10. One of the better alphas out there, but not worth the $50 price tag in my opinion. Wait a year for the game's price to decrease as the dollar-per-hour rate of this game is not worth it just yet.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Squad is a large-scale FPS with support for up to 100 players in various gamemodes. The development team, Offworld Industries, is largely made up of former developers for Project Reality: BF2, one of the oldest and most popular mods for Battlefield 2.

The focus of Squad is on semi-realistic teamplay that revolved around squads. There are a few different gamemodes, such as Conquest, Assault And Secure, and Insurgency. All of these gamemodes have varying objectives and ways to win.

My personal favorite mode is Insurgency, which pits a faction of insurgents against US forces. The insurgent team is tasked with protecting a series of weapons caches, the position of which is unknown to US forces at the beginning. By gathering intel, the US forces can get the rough location of a cache and with enough intel they can determe the exact location of a cache. After destroying a certain number of caches, the US forces win. However, they have limited tickets so casualties are not something they can afford as opposed to the insurgents who have an unlimited number of tickets, but only a few caches.

The majority of the Squad community is mature and helpful. There are many community servers with good people that inhabit them. When playing with a proper squad you will have one of the best times ever.

The sounds and the graphics are pretty solid, although the game is currently rather demanding on the spec side. This will change as the game is optimized.

I definitely recommend Squad, even  in early access. This is going to be one of my few go-to games for a long time coming. There are bugs and glitches that may pop up every now and then, but the developers are working diligently to make this one of the best tactical games available.

I look forward to seeing and playing with you all. I'll be playing on the server that my community (CIA Gaming) hosts.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis is the shooter I have bene waiting for. I am excited that this game is finally released to the rifleman and other steam users. It is kind of a learning curve but if you just use your knowledge from other realistic shooters you can do well in this game. So far playing medic has been the most fun for me personally. It is awesome being able to bring back your squad and teammates back into the fight and having them rely on you. One personal tip is if youre going to be a squad leader to coordinate with other squad leaders. One example is we built a nice fob but it came under attack and we were naded and suffering massive causilties I was able to coordinate a counter attack by going out the back of the fob and clearing out our perimeter then we were able to take the fight to the enemy. This game is alot of fun and in order to get the full enjoyment make sure you have a mic, and dont even think about team killing.

Early Access Review

If you´re like me and tried to get into Arma 2 and Arma 3, but just couldn´t get the game
to feel that special tactical way you wanted, Squad is for you.
Without going into overcomplicating control schemes, Squad captures teamwork and realistic combat scenarios
in a super addicting way.
I came from the Project Reality game thinking it was a godsend, and I am stoked to see how Squad continues to
develop.
If you like small scale roleplaying as a soldier, talking military jargon over your mic and just having a fun exciting
time with your squadmates, this game is for you.
If you like fast, twitch-reflexed FPSes and leaderbords, this game is not for you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First review here so bear with me.  This is an excellent game if you are willing to be a member of a team.  If you are a lone wolf and think you are a super hero who needs to carry your team to victory, steer clear!  This game will punish you for attempting such tactics.

This is more of a sim then a game imo.  Not so much that the damage is realistic or the ballistics.  Its more or less how the players/teams interact and move around the battlefield. It is not uncommon to get zero kills or to spend a whole match guarding an objective without much action.

Disclaimer out of the way.  This is a fantasticly well made game with a great community.  Great graphics (the maps are amazing) and great gameplay.  If you want to be part of a team look no further.  Squad gets a 10/10 from me.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is my first review, yes it may be a little choppy and rusty but lets go

My first thoughts before even purchasing this game were, omg this game just looks amazing, just from looking at youtube videos of this game

So i decided to prepurchase the rifleman tier package, in early august to await the release date

When i finally got it, (today), playing it was just a blast.

This game takes SKILL, there is no Run And Gun, rush tactics usually do not work, and playing on your own simply just cannot be.

This game you have to be smart, and be tactical at the same time. The team with the best SQUAD work will overcome any objective.

PROS
- Graphics Are Simply Amazing
- Reload animations are on point
- Coms are very reliable
- Community so far is great
- Maps are HUGE, and will get bigger over time
- Guns are realistic, factions look realistic
There are more definatly

CONS
-Alpha Build
-Wish Vehicles were in but not yet
- Optimization isnt the best but playable
These cons are not really important, because the game is amazing

Overall, if you want a realistic modern FPS shooter, this is defantly worth your money.
I will put hours of gameplay and streaming in to this game for sure
Sometimes you will be running around not seeing enemies for hours, but once you get into that firefight, the fun kicks in

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Lemme start with the fact that it is a bit OVER PRICED.

Although I am making this review as a Positive, it really depends on the player himself. One round squad is very fun, and the next round, it is a mess. When it is at its best, is when everyone is working as a team and are communicating effectively. These moments are very cool to be a part of. On the other side of the coin, sometimes the gameplay can feel random, with people not working as a team, or the teams being unbalanced. I would call this a cautious purchase. It is very fun and unique for steam, but needs to be further developed for me to recommend this to EVERYONE. This being said, if you are a fan of the genre, and played Project Reality, or Tactical Battlefield for Arma 3, then I would say to go for it, as the price may increase, as time passes. It is also fun with friends. If you are not sure I would recommend waiting for a sale, or try out Project Reality (For free!).

Video Review (Recomend for more detail)
