reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nMade by the veterans of the Project Reality modification for Battlefield 2, winner of countless awards for its achievements in creating a realistic modern warfare game with the now seemingly ancient BF2 engine.  Squad takes that foundation and plants those tried and tested modules" (medic system
hoursPlayed: large maps
voteText: teamwork
helpfulPercent: etc) and plants them into the Unreal Engine with ease.  Still in early access at the writing of this review
votesHelpful: Squad is currently focused on the infantry battle (50 v 50) but has already begun working the implementation of air and ground assets.  Currently in game are the US Army
votesTotal: Russians
votesFunny: Taliban
commentsCount: and Militia (a sort of Chechnya catch all of sorts with various equipment from multiple origins)\n\nThe infantry and basic rifle/shooting mechanics are already solid with regular tweaks to ensure the game mirrors realistic weapon usage.  No doubt bigger things are planned for infantry weapons but the core mechanics are there to great effect. A stamina system keeps players from running and gunning - adding sway to your rifle when tired.  Similarly
column16: you must slow your movement before regaining stamina.  Stamina also determines how well you can focus your aim for an accurate shot - though you'll spend just as much time firing in the general direction of the enemy to provide support by fire for your maneuver force.\n\nTeamwork is key in this game with specialist weapons and gear only being made available to members of a squad.  If you want an automatic rifleman
column17: medic
column18: RPG/LAW gunner for support you'd better join a squad.  Team communication is
column19: of course
column20: also key and the positional and squad based communications setup is perfect for this.  You'll want to get a microphone to be sure you can be a functioning teammate.  One key talks to all members in your squad (currently 9 man) regardless of distance to one another and a second button communicates with anyone within several meters of your position - allowing you to coordinate within your own squad but also with that random teammate you find yourself taking cover with inside a compound surrounded by angry Taliban.\n\nThe graphics are beautiful and are only improving.  There are some who experience hiccups or sluggish FPS on some of the more intensive maps
column21: but regular updates have streamlined both assets and the mechanics to improve FPS across the board.  A decent rig is recommended as you'll want to up that view distance (These are impressively large maps) and resolution to ensure you are seeing everything and feeding that all important situational awareness.  Tracers and explosions are so great to observe
column22:
you almost wish you were closer to that explosion so you could see it better - then realize that's a death wish.

Sound is equally impressive.  Incoming rounds snap past and smack into the earth and walls and the  dynamic gunfire sounds based on range sucks you into the world.  Environment sounds are there as well and overall it complements the chaos of sporadic battles.

The game is also unforgiving in that one or two shots from a rifle are enough to take down most players.  Grenades are powerful enough to take out multiple players who don't pay attention to their squad's spacing.  You'd be wise to take a medic or two along in your squad.  Medics can heal minor wounds and also revive downed players giving your squad the ability to recover and sustain itself after a (semi) successful engagement.  This is all the more vital when spawn points are almost entirely player driven.  Your squad leader should not only be issuing verbal orders to your squad of 9 but also should be placing Rally Points - a spawn point in the form of assault packs/ammo boxes that only your squad uses.  Additionally your team can place Forward Operating Bases (FOBs) that allow the entire team to spawn there.  Add in the ability to place HESCO walls
column23: sandbag bunkers
column24: concertina wire
column26: all player driven - and you have the option of building up some impressive defensive positions and providing dynamic gameplay that is different each time you play.\n\nIf you're still wondering if this is an early access game worth investing in I can tell you right now that this team knows what it's doing
column28: and will not stop until this game is everything it can be - it's already well on its way.\n\nSquad's ready

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have often heard this game described as a shooter that sits somewhere between the Battlefield and ARMA franchises and, to me, this description is spot on. A realistic, team based, modern day shooter fought over large maps with a variety of objective-based game modes with an emphasis on team work. Whilst the game is still in early access, the concept is there and is definitely playable AND enjoyable in its current state - sweet graphics, awesome sounds, great gameplay and it runs infinitely better than ARMA - what more can a guy ask for?

If you are looking for a new, realistic, team/VOIP based shooter this is definitely worth checking out. Will update this review as the game progresses - for now it is a solid thumbs up.
voteText: 7 of 12 people (58%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Medium paced tactical shooter that encourages and rewards teamplay. In the future we'll have logistics, aircraft, ground vehicles (tanks, apcs, transport) and static emplacements which will slow the pace of the game down quite a bit. What the game offers now is a robust infantry based shooter, that has great Squad based gameplay. The games really come together when you have a squad leader who communicates and focuses on the objectives / winning and a Squad that is willing to listen and follow orders. I would highly suggest if you pick this game up to listen to and stick with your Squad Leader, especially if hes communicating and giving orders. If you end up in a silent squad that is all playing by themselves and not communicating I would suggest joining a different squad or give leading a go. It makes the game much more fun and your Squad will be infinitley more effective.

So far in the game we have some nice systems including the ability to build up bases anywhere on the map with a great building system, the squad leader places objects down and his squad can build them up with E-Tools. Large maps that will probably only get larger when vehicles are included, and various game modes including Advance and Secure (sector control gamemode) and Insurgency (find the insurgent weapon cache sites and destroy them). Also included in the game so fare are 4 different factions all with realistic loadouts and loadout restrictions within your squad based on how many people you have in your squad and how many of the kits are already taken.

If you play and enjoy Insurgency, Arma, Project Reality, and maybe even Battlefield I'm sure you can find fun and enoyment in this game. For $40 this game is very worth the buy, you'll be engrossed in the game at times and hours will just fly by as you have fun participating in large scale battles and securing objectives with your squad.

Final note: If your a player who doesn't like playing as a team, this game may or may not be for you. I believe lone wolf" shouldn't be shunned away but if you refuse to play as a team and listen to your squad leader I only ask that you DO NOT JOIN A SQUAD AND TAKE A USEFULL KIT ONLY TO BE SILENT THE WHOLE GAME AND GO OFF AND PLAY BY YOURSELF
date: IF YOU WANT TO PLAY LIKE THAT JUST DON'T JOIN A SQUAD."

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI've purchased the game back in October for $70, months before the Early Access release and I can already tell that this game is already better than many AAA titles in the gaming industry. It is simply the best tactical shooter I have ever had an occasion to play and its just in Alpha stage!. Extremely replayable, addicting and rewardable if you work and communicate as a team which is the main core concept of the game. Squad is supposed to fill the gap between Arma 3 and Battlefield and does it perfectly. Developers are doing a great job and put a lot of heart into the development. They are active on the forums and actually listen to the players. Can't recommend a better tactical shooter than Squad.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've played since the start of the closed alpha. Squad is easily the most polished alpha I've ever played. While it obviously has a long way to go it is in a very playable state.

Things you need:

A microphone. Silent players are dead weight and you'll likely be kicked from your squad for someone with a mic.

A sense of teamwork. Lone wolf players will die and again, likely be kicked by their squad leader for not following orders.

This is not your typical run and gun shooter like Battlefield or Call of Duty. You need to communicate and cooperate to achive your goals in this game. It's not about your individual score, it's about winning as a team, as a Squad.
voteText: 8 of 14 people (57%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Even in its current state (early alpha) Squad is one of the finest shooters I have played to date. The teamwork and the passion from the community make for some of the most memorable matches I've played in an FPS game, with a level of intensity that other games can only strive to replicate.

The game (especially the effects from explosions and bullet impacts) is, in my opinion, beautiful. While it still needs some optimization, I can assure you that the devs are passionate about improving the overall gameplay experience.

Please note that this game is NOT for the lone wolf type. Not only does failing to join a squad limit your choice of weapon loadout, but your ability to communicate will be severely limited and death is likely to find you quickly. Join a squad, listen to your squad leader's commands, and you will find the game both fun and rewarding.

Pros:
Community
Graphics and Effects
Dynamic Gameplay
Excellent Built-in VOIP
Gunplay is far superior to games like ArmA (ArmA vet here)
Cons:
Could use a bit more optimization, especially for AMD folks
Get this game, join a Squad, and have fun!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have been following the progress from this game from the early moments when it was still just some weapons in artwork, now that i have been a backer since May since its Kickstart campaign launched i have seen the game grow allot and many updates have been coming out of the developers factory!

if you are unaware, Squad is based on Project Reality, a (now standlone) mod for BF2, its still very popular and still being updated! Squad's goal is to get as close as possible to the goodness that is PR, now i have to warn you, this is still a ALPHA build, so that means bugs, glitches, lack of optimization and lack of content, this is a raw build on what the game could be. They are working hard on adding vehicles and if you follow their updates you would know they are nearly done with the Humvee's! An armored personnel carrier is also in the works! Some people have been complaining about the price, but don't forget that this money does not go into the pockets of the developers, its used for the game, so your money is backing up the development of this game. So expect bugs, glitches and such, but report them on their forum so they can work them out even faster!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Today i had a game where it was neck and neck all the way, i was leading the squad as we were capturing the objective we had 20 tickets left i called that None shall respawn and let the medics do there job. I noticed that the enemy had an FOB on the ridge line next to the objective at this point it was down to the hair on my butt close, we had 7 tickets left. As we cap the objective i call for my squad to throw all the smoke we have and charge the FOB, we lay a quilt of white smoke around the entire objective, I lead the charge as my comrades follow, up the hill shooting militia left right and center, we lay prone now 5m from the FOB, in go the frags and smokes. We oblitrate the enemy inside, 4 men jump on the forward operating base shovleing it away, success its now destroyed! i call for the squad to just clean the mountains and sweep through the brush to try and eliminate the enemys last remaining tickets. The enemy start to call GG, the game finishes with the scoreboard showing You have won the enemy team has been eliminated the squad cheer in exitement, We won by 6 tickets!




12/10 would go down to the wire again!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Although ive only played this game for 9 hours, it is becomming one of my favorite online games ive ever played. Most of the time, I stay away from early acess titles, but after watching some people play it on twitch I decided to pick it up. Squad demands you to work as a team, becuase if you dont you will lose every time. In my opnion, Squad may be one of the best team-orenentied games avalible right now.

PROS:

+Game requires teamwork for you to succede, and because of this all the kiddies who think its another COD or Battlefield are quickly driven off.

+Basebuilding mechanic is very cool

+The battles you get into can range from small skirmishes to large conficts over a base. The battles are ver intense and diffrent every time.

+The medical system is pretty cool, squads can have up to two medics, and to revive someone who is down you must first bandage their body then heal them with a medical bag. THe whole process takes ~90 seconds which makes healing someone in the middle of a battle much more intense.

+1 sniper limit per squad, thank god

+The sound quality is very good, bullets flying by sound amazing

+The suppression system in this game isnt annoying like it is in games like Battlefield

+Server sise is pretty nice, averging 64-72 player slots, it is *supposedley* goignt to be 100 slot servers when the game fully comes out

+In my experience, about 90% of the players have mics, and 95% of the players are actually trying to play as a team.

CONS

-Early acess game

-No vheicles YET

-Cant drag bodies of teammates to cover YET

-Guns are very limited for now, but i they may be more in the future

-Spawn system is a little clunky

-Not many maps for now, but im sure there will be more in future updates

OVERALL

If you're like me and really enjoy military sims/ teamwork games this is a must buy. In short its an advanced, more teamwork oriented Arma without all the Arma ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t, and maps that are big enough to be interesting, but small enough that you will find people to fight against.

8/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As the net-code for BF2 version of Project Reality is showing it's age, Squad steps up to take it's place. While the game is still in Alpha it shows promise by combining realism with ease of use and tries to lower the learning curve seen in other games.

Pros:
Easy layout and objectives
Great communication system
Straight-forward controls and squad system
Balance of equipment for teams

Cons:
Graphics issues won't let you really see the enemy past 150 meters
Some stuttering, especially when smoke grenades are used
Low ammunition capacity for loadouts (5 mags when it should be 9-10 for riflemen)
Same teams that you see in every modern fps (ie, US Army VS Insurgents, US VS Russia, Russia VS other insurgents). It'd be nice to see more interesting teams (Finland VS Russia, Pakistan VS India, US VS South American Drug Cartels)

Fortunately, all of these cons are easily fixable with patches and DLC. It's shaping up to be a great game and I'm glad to be along for the ride.

You get the atmosphere of the game while playing, you have the feeling to be a real soldier.

9/11 would friendly fire again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Squad has a world of potential and even in its current alpha state is an amazing game, the first contact you make with the enemy will just about scare the crap out of you, especially if you dont have some idea where they may be, even then the sound of a bullet whizing past your head, cracking nearby or an RPG landing near you will have you hitting the deck hard & fast. The teamwork needed to excel in this game is excellent as it brings alot more realism and stops alot of lone wolves thinking they can rambo their way through the enemy, this in not Cod and should not be played like it is, if you move as a squad & work together with your squad leaders you will overcome your enemy & taste sweet victory, if you choose to fight alone and disorganised you will help lead your squads to a quick defeat.

I would recommend this game to all, although if some of the creators happen to read this i understand you have an enormous amount of work ahead of you & im very impressed with your current work, but if possible could you prioritze server security and stability as all servers seem to be getting DDOS & hacked at the moment & playability is almost impossible at this time, also the graphics could use some tweaks & to be optimized as i find mine to be blurry no matter what level i run it at from low to epic on some maps, but im sure you already have alot of that on the list, i really think people will apreaciate stable gameplay and an optimized display more at this stage in early development.

With that said keep up the great work & have a happy new year !
i'll see you in the field.

This is what i've always wanted from an fps game.

Pro's:
-The way that it forces you to work together is awesome, too many games now adays where you are on your own and going all rambo on everyone.
-Huge maps make for endless hours of tactical gameplay.
-3 different comm systems make for more realistic communictation between squads and within squads themselves
-Just the realism in general is hnnnngggh

Con's:
-Like any old Alpha build game, there are quite a few bugs
-For example at times you could be hopping down a mountian side, next thing when you are pinned down behind a low wall and need to hop over it to get to the build just a few meters infront of you, all the sudden your legs dont know how to jump for some reason.

Other than that it's just an awesome game, sure you'll always find those one or two guys up on the hill with a rifle (Not even a sniper rifle half the time) that always manages to see you across the map and pump you full of lead.

Anywho, welcome to Squad Private.

And remember, crouch + E when you are in the poppies.

Good luck and dont let them blow your face off maggot!
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Everything I wanted in a tactical military shooter. In short, what you hoped combat in Arma 3 would be.

Some positives:
>No top class, they all have their place.
>Extremely team play focused.
>Engagements are often long and exciting.
>Firefights however are fast and bloody.
>Locating and identifying contact is just the right level of difficult.
>Maps are vast and offer many different approaches to objectives and multisquad coordination.
>No kill indicator - this can sound like a pain but it adds a nice level of immersion, realism, and suspense - not being sure if you actually downed your contact.
>Medics are done well. They can revive the team but will eventually run out of supplies to patch people up. Keeps from having those Arma revive contests.
>Very clear VOIP chat - also squad based so you don't get the full team chatter you find in other games.


Some negatives:
>Server browser is a little sub par - not detremental but makes it a little more difficult to hook up with friends.
>No in game friends list - little hard to drop in on a friend already playing as you need to actually locate the server in the browser.

tldr: Great game, especially for Early Access. I have been having a great time. I hope the devs continue doing what they are doing and get a lot of support.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSquad is a hardcore shooter and is definately worth your money!  You can play as squad leader, medic, light machine gunner, rifleman, grenadier or rpg'r.  This is a game that really requires that players work together.  Squad lives up to it's name there.  Squad leaders can coordinate defence or attacks with other squads or work on their own.  SL's can place rally point's and forward operating base's.  As well as hesco's barbed wire and sandbags.  In other words, you can improve defences anywhere you want.  It's more of a simulation than most other shooters so if it's realism you want then this is your game.  In closing ... I denfinitley recommend buying Squad!!

The first time I started up squad I was in a state of excited apprehension. The concept of the game sounds absolutely fantastic; and as someone who had never played project reality, I had no idea what to expect.

I spawned in on the USA side and quickly learned the buttons to speak to squad. The UI is fairly easy to work out: how to join a team, how to join a squad, where to spawn, what your role is etc. So anyway, I'm in the map now and start running toward my squad. Little do I know that I've spawned into the middle of a battle and bang I'm dead from an unknown enemy in an unknown position. Ok" I think

voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Squad has a world of potential and even in its current alpha state is an amazing game, the first contact you make with the enemy will just about scare the crap out of you, especially if you dont have some idea where they may be, even then the sound of a bullet whizing past your head, cracking nearby or an RPG landing near you will have you hitting the deck hard & fast. The teamwork needed to excel in this game is excellent as it brings alot more realism and stops alot of lone wolves thinking they can rambo their way through the enemy, this in not Cod and should not be played like it is, if you move as a squad & work together with your squad leaders you will overcome your enemy & taste sweet victory, if you choose to fight alone and disorganised you will help lead your squads to a quick defeat.

I would recommend this game to all, although if some of the creators happen to read this i understand you have an enormous amount of work ahead of you & im very impressed with your current work, but if possible could you prioritze server security and stability as all servers seem to be getting DDOS & hacked at the moment & playability is almost impossible at this time, also the graphics could use some tweaks & to be optimized as i find mine to be blurry no matter what level i run it at from low to epic on some maps, but im sure you already have alot of that on the list, i really think people will apreaciate stable gameplay and an optimized display more at this stage in early development.

With that said keep up the great work & have a happy new year !
i'll see you in the field.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIt's what we have all wanted for a very long time. Let me begin with the gameplay. It is fantastic, it rewards teamwork and patience, and punishes those who are careless. This is the only game I have ever played where not only has it been extremely beneficial to use voice communication with other players, but I have actually wanted to use voice chat myself to alert squadmates about enemies, where to move, etc. Not to mention everyone has been really mature, the community has been pretty good. The DEVS! I gotta give it to these guys, they are dedicated, and do not slack at all. They have fixed multiple bugs and frame issues within two or three days of the game being released on Steam. They stay on top of it, and listen to their community. I will gladly support these guys with my $40 because I know it is being used to progress this amazing game even further.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Tactical, team communication, realistic firefights, base building, mature community, the overall gameplay feels immersive.  It's a game that requires patience & good communication.  Has a learning curve to it, took some time and tutorial browsing to get more familiar with the features, objectives, etc.

Couple bugs I've encountered, mainly crashes (Typically after a match).  Some frame dips, poor server browser UI, no tutorial system for new players (Unlesss you search it up), and some other small things I dislike.  However the current build I'm doing this review on is Alpha" so that's expected from any game that early in a build.

After playing BF2: Project Reality mod this team has worked on I'm excited to see what they have in store for us.  This game has soooooo much potential
date: just imagine with what we have now how good of a game this can grow to be with more content/fixes in the months to come.  I've heard and seen the great things this Dev team have accomplished and can do

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is very unfinished at the moment and also needs to be much more optimised.

However, I have thoroughly enjoyed playing this immersive multiplayer shooter. The key to the successful multiplayer is that this game encourages teamwork and without that cooperative gameplay, this game in its current state wouldn't be all that great.

It can be a very slow paced game (so it is not for those arcade/CQC shooters) however this adds to the immersion and when your team finishes and wins a match, it feels like a huge accomplishment, and scoring kills is just as satisfying.

If you enjoy the Arma series or Insurgency, I'm sure you'll enjoy this game as well.

The only things I would say that the gameplay needs:
Vehicles
More weapon variety
Bug fixes

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Positive review for now. But read before you buy.

Pretty much the child of Arma 3 and Insurgancy you have always wanted;  infected with ideas from CoD, CS, and BF4

Like the BF series, much like the original Project Reality, this game needs to decide what it wants to be. Too often does it flip flop between wanting to be a super intelligent tactical FPS and a twitchy arcade fps shooter. While its end goal is to be hybrid of arcade and simulation, Currently, it is not a happy marrige. This game has a chaince to be a unique tactical game, but too often allows itself to become another run around and shoot until you die and respawn.  The ideas in this game often fight eachother. I hope they can decide what they want this to be before they hit beta.

The Good:
1. Perfect Sized Maps for the number of players.
2. Sometimes you get a great feeling of tactical realism, squad vs squad fire fights can be very fun!
3. Very Polished for an Alpha, showing great potential
4. When you have a group of 35vs35 people playing the game right" it is super fun.
5. Damage System is fair
hoursPlayed:
8 . class balance feels good.

This game has a lot going for it. BUT


The Bad:
1. Game all too often turns into typcial
voteText: Battlefeid type
helpfulPercent: "place rally points: capture flags by attrition" gameplay.\n2. The tools for proper team play aren't there
votesHelpful: (no planning phase
votesTotal: no map drawing
votesFunny: no custom objective
commentsCount: etc). You can't do anything about people on the server who refuse to play as a team (no vote kick).\n3. Death penalty is too minimal; little incentive to wait for a medic. No way to prevent non-teamplayers from wasting team tickets.\n4. At first listen
column16: the sound is excellent. However positional audio doesn't have an Obstruction System
column17: so terrian/object doesn't matter
column18: only distance
column19: making for some weird sounding situations when you hear an enemy firing from behind a wall right next to you. Radio doesn't have distortion either. You can't hear enemy players on local voice chat (choice by the dev
column20: they think everyone will use team speak).\n5. Basebuilding is super fun
column21: but doesn't serve a real purpose right now.\n5. Community can be extreamly abrasive. According to many of them
column22: the Devs have the perfect game in mind
column23: they ask for feedback but don't want to hear it unless it is what they want to hear.\n\nFor me
column24: the game breaker is the rally points. They flip the dial too far to the arcade side
column26: they switch the strategy from tactics to spamming and attrition.  While there may be a better way to fix them
column27: it would be as simple as changing it to a paradrop (instead of people spawning out of a backpack). I don't know how the current rally point/spawn system would be compabilty with veichals (people would just spam spawning anti-tank). So hope it's a place holder.\n\nAlso
column28: the over-embellished gameplay stories many fans have been posting in the reviews are just setting unrealistic expectations for the game. this game will not give you PTSD (thats not even a funny thing to joke about).\n\nBut it's still fun. I like these kind of Games

reviewText:
Early Access Review

One of the best Tastical Shooters out there.

Pros:
Team work in essential. You HAVE to work together in order to win.
The gameplay is really smooth and has been thought out well.
The spawns. To create spawn locations you have work as a team. (You need to be near a squad member to place a spawn becon)
Haven't seen any salty people. So that's a plus.
You can't run and gun like in Call of Duty. (You have to take it slow and check all the corners and not run in the middle of the field and hope not to get shot).
Cons:
The optimization isn't the best. You might need a GTX 770+ and i5+ to run this smoothly.
The Americas have to ability to shoot from long ranges because they have access to long ranges scopes and both enemy teams don't have that. (America broken af)
That's all I could think of.
Overall REALLY fun/awesome game! Would recommend this to anyone.
I don't think it's worth $55 AUD though. That's another bad part about this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Okay, 40 hours in I think is enough to give this a good review.

What a ♥♥♥♥ing game!

I've not had this much fun in a game for a long time, I've also not shouted so loud, raged so much and creamed my pants anymore than during this game.

There are moments of utter terror, moments of utter joy & moments of amazing hilarity.

The performance is good, not great, but good for a EA game. People who complain about performance.....well, none of you must have played Ark when it first came out, when people running 980's were getting 10fps on high settings. This game performs VERY well for where it is at right now. I run an i5 & gtx970 and i'm getting a consistent 50-60 frames with everything on high.

The gameplay is amazing, there are some issues, obviously with it being in Alpha, however, theses are outweighed by the good elements. The guns feel amazing to fire, they sound incredible, and the HE are scary as ♥♥♥♥ when you are on the receiving end.

Team work is good in this game, there are still a number of clueless players, and/or idiots who lonewolf, but the vast majority of players are here to play together with other.

I look forward to more content and updates as the time passes, and I can imagine that I will have 100's if not 1000's of hours in game by the time it is actually released.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This isn't just some shooter, it's almost the only FPS game in the market where it's players should go along with the rest of the squad in massive battles. This is the game where the objective should matter more than just the kills, like in PR. If you are used to other FPS games, the thing first you should know, that you will have to work with your squad and follow your squadlead's orders and plans. A full and coordinated squad can do more than just a lone guy.

For an early access title, basic features are implemented and it'll run ok in multiplayer, if you have a somewhat good PC with intel CPU and Nvidia GPU. As these guys developed Project Reality mod for BF2 for free in their spare time. Squad will have constant updates a lot more faster compared to PR as the devs are getting paid to do so.

I love the sound effects as they sound very realistic, but for the sake of possibly losing your hearing you might want to lower the volume down, it still sounds as awesome after that.

This is the game for those fellas who want more teamwork based gameplay, as usually in BF and cod sort of games you really don't need teamwork to win. Once you learn the habits of how you should play Squad, the experience of the game will improve a lot.

I've played FPS games for a long time, but Project Reality and Squad are my favorites now, Arma holds it's own place, but not so so much for PvP Team VS Team aspect. I will recommend this game for those who are willing to play an early access game and like the more realistic take on intense FPS PvP combat with a lot of teamwork.
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I was the only American in an All-German Squad. I asked our squad leader to sing O' Tannenbaum because I never heard a real, live, German rendition of the Classic. He chuckled, obviously not expecting such an odd request as we were in the process of heading towards an enemy outpost. However, at my insistence, he began. The first beautiful notes rung throughout the hills as he began the Christmas tune. At the same time as those notes began, enemy fire started to rain down on us. I never strode into battle to such a joyous tune.

One by one our squad members fell to the ground. Seeing no hope left, surrounded by enemies, our squad leader pulled the pin on his grenade and charged forward, blowing himself up, bewildering our foes, in a final blaze of glory as the last note rung throughout the hills.

10/10 Best Community Ever.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ive been with Squad since early closed Alpha. It is, hands down, the best co-op tactical game ever made. If you liked Insurgency for the teamwork and communication but thought it left a lot to be desired, then Squad is for you.

You can not lone wolf (we'll kick you anyway if you try). Youre tied to your squad. Every role (class) is equally important. That is something that no game to date has truly achieved. Well, its here. You know how every n00b likes to be a sniper"? Not here. Those n00bs will be bored with that role after a few minutes. We need real recon. And that is what we get. Heck
date: if youre furstrated with every game that has n00bs rushing in to be snipers to get kills from long range (because they have no skill) then this game is for you. Just the releif from that well-known scenario in multiplayer FPS is woth the price. On my last trip with SL Tomabova (Toma18) we moved the entire squad around the southside of an enemy squad. Our goal was to find their Rally Points (spawn points) and FOB's (Forward operating Bases) and destroy them. They were hitting the objective our team was guarding so fast that they had to be close. So
recommended: here is where the n00b snipers will quit...our snipers hang back. They watch. Real recon. When there is a lone guy SL gives the call to take him out. One shot. Its over. We found the FOB and used our shovels to dig it up. We tracked the enemy as a squad. We eliminated the immediate threat. And then time for the good part
hoursPlayed:
what everyone in the Squad has been waiting for...

The other squads radio back to Toma18. The last wave of spawns (the ones that spwaned in while we were moving on their flank) has made it to the objective and is hitting it hard. Now we are in a great position. By following the same line to the objective the enmy wont look at us twice. If they see movement from behind they think its their team mates. A deadly supposition to make.

We wipe the squad. Its game over now. Toma18 says [sic] "I love being the one squad that comes out of nowhere and wipes everyone out in seconds". Second.

I havent even mentioned all the great stuff like base and reinforcement building. It has everything. Vehicles are coming. It has a learning curve but it isnt steep. Join us. Hop in and dontbe afraid to ask questions. If you see Socrates in a Squad join that squad and he'll have you acting like a seasoned player in minutes. We're waiting for you."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Squad is honestly shaping up to be one of the greatest MIL-SIMs of all time.

|-Overview-|

Squad is a realistic, tactical, skill-based FPS. Squad requires TEAMWORK and COMMUNICATION, and a mic is necessary to succeed.

|-Pros-|
-Active Devs and they Listen to the community
-Tactical
-Very Tense/Lots of Action
-Team Oriented
-Skill-Based
-Authenticity (The audio and Gun models are spot on)
-Graphics are pretty good
-Great community
-Audio is spot on
-Just overall great fun, and even more fun with friends

|-Cons-|

-This game is EARLY ACCESS so there will be bugs and Glitches
-Game apparently has problems with AMD CPUs (People have been saying that I do not have an AMD CPU)
-A bit unoptimized on some maps

|-Conclusion-|

Squad is awesome and I cannot wait till this game is finished. I would completely recommend.

Would rate HOORAH!/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

-Playing as Jihadi's
-Realizing spraying around bullets will not work
-Formed my squad up in a line and tried to move up and overthrow the American pigdogs
-Popped massive smoke and prepared to charge
-Whole team shouts 'ALLAHU ACKBAR' and screams; 'JALALALALALALALALLALA' running down the hill and shooting everything on sight
-No one dies, succesfully assaulted compound and wiped out everything on sight

Never had this kind of experience in a tactical shooter.

Jihadi Joe simulator 2016.  10/10 would 'JALALALALA' charge again.

Serious note:

+

Squad is a tactical shooter, accessable for both experienced and unexperienced players.
Learning curve is steep at first but you'll get the hang of it soon enough.
The voice chat channels are amazing and work fine. Most of the players are serious and determined to help their squad to be the victor.
It's a hard game, this is not Call of Duty. Whereas it finds the thin line between a military simulator and a enjoyable casual shooter. Which is a good thing, we don't need another CoD.

-

The game is not yet optimized. I have a good computer but it's having a hard time especially on crowded servers.
If you are not prepared to downscale your graphics or spend some minutes finding a good server i do not recommend to buy it yet.
I am sure the devs will fix this later.
Some animation glitches will occur. Again, this is an Alpha.

Actually, the cons are all things that will be fixed in the future. I will get back on reviewing this when the game is fully out and optimized.

For now i could recommend it for real dedicated players who love tactical shooters.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

One of the best Tastical Shooters out there.

Pros:
Team work in essential. You HAVE to work together in order to win.
The gameplay is really smooth and has been thought out well.
The spawns. To create spawn locations you have work as a team. (You need to be near a squad member to place a spawn becon)
Haven't seen any salty people. So that's a plus.
You can't run and gun like in Call of Duty. (You have to take it slow and check all the corners and not run in the middle of the field and hope not to get shot).
Cons:
The optimization isn't the best. You might need a GTX 770+ and i5+ to run this smoothly.
The Americas have to ability to shoot from long ranges because they have access to long ranges scopes and both enemy teams don't have that. (America broken af)
That's all I could think of.
Overall REALLY fun/awesome game! Would recommend this to anyone.
I don't think it's worth $55 AUD though. That's another bad part about this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's highly realistic, one headshot and you're dead. The graphics are amazing but not optmised. The gameplay is heart-racing, adrenline-pumping fun. On the other hand, the game is incomplete and AMD graphics are suffering.

The Development team is highly dedicated to this project, streaming their game development on twitch and keeping their players fully aware of their game's roadmap. As well as growing their team and gaining more talent (providing a higher quality game.)

Other details:
VAC is integrated in the game.

This game is the follow-up to Project Reality, a battlefield 2 and Arma 2 mod.

A team focused game, built around a player/squad-role system.

A game you can go in with no friends, and come out of with 9 new friends.

Beware: This isn't a game where one player can carry their entire team. It requires communication between players (in any form: text chat or voice,) and the ability to give out orders as squad leader or follow orders as a solder.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Great game for alpha. Very tactical and fun. Needs optimization, and dedicated servers.


Though this is reliant on a good squad and squad-mates. A ♥♥♥♥♥♥ squad leader will lead to the game turning into a running simulator, and have also noticed a lot of trolls in the game. Militia and Russian's need optics though. Not fair to be getting picked off by the US from a mile away while the iron-sights you have can barley see 100ft. And the US does not have a sniper, seems like they tried to equal it out with militia and Russia having no optics while the US does but with no sniper, it doesn't make sense. Gun sounds are amazing, nothing like not being able to hear your team-mates talk when you have a m249 in your ear. Player models are similar and hard to tell friendly's from contacts. I realize its realism, but lets also not forget it is a game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Squad is a unique blend of mil-sim that can't really be compared to anything else.

But if you must, then:
- It's prettier than Project Reality
- It's more action orientated than ArmA
- It's as tactically stimulating as Rainbow 6 and SWAT used to be
- It sounds better than BF4 (seriously, the sfx are amazing)

I was hesitant about the price point like so many others, but it is the best £30 I spent on games in 2015 (and I only bought it in the last week). Worth every penny.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

One of the best Tastical Shooters out there.

Pros:
Team work in essential. You HAVE to work together in order to win.
The gameplay is really smooth and has been thought out well.
The spawns. To create spawn locations you have work as a team. (You need to be near a squad member to place a spawn becon)
Haven't seen any salty people. So that's a plus.
You can't run and gun like in Call of Duty. (You have to take it slow and check all the corners and not run in the middle of the field and hope not to get shot).
Cons:
The optimization isn't the best. You might need a GTX 770+ and i5+ to run this smoothly.
The Americas have to ability to shoot from long ranges because they have access to long ranges scopes and both enemy teams don't have that. (America broken af)
That's all I could think of.
Overall REALLY fun/awesome game! Would recommend this to anyone.
I don't think it's worth $55 AUD though. That's another bad part about this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My first time in game i just followed my squad staying at the back because I had no idea what was going on, got told to guard west entrance of a compound, next minute ''alluha akbar'' attack managed to switch gun to full auto and took out like 3 guys before i got killed and luckily the medic in our squad saved me 10/10 first impression.

Since then I have made a few notes:

>encourages teamwork and stratagy, rambo style usually doesnt pay off (finally a game that makes sense).
>best sound effects of pretty much any other war game.
>it needs some optimization but encouraging so far and gets monthly updates.
>good detail huge maps.
>filtered out all of the cod players for what seem a good/mature community.

9.5/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Positive review for now. But read before you buy.

Pretty much the child of Arma 3 and Insurgancy you have always wanted;  infected with ideas from CoD, CS, and BF4

Like the BF series, much like the original Project Reality, this game needs to decide what it wants to be. Too often does it flip flop between wanting to be a super intelligent tactical FPS and a twitchy arcade fps shooter. While its end goal is to be hybrid of arcade and simulation, Currently, it is not a happy marrige. This game has a chaince to be a unique tactical game, but too often allows itself to become another run around and shoot until you die and respawn.  The ideas in this game often fight eachother. I hope they can decide what they want this to be before they hit beta.

The Good:
1. Perfect Sized Maps for the number of players.
2. Sometimes you get a great feeling of tactical realism, squad vs squad fire fights can be very fun!
3. Very Polished for an Alpha, showing great potential
4. When you have a group of 35vs35 people playing the game right" it is super fun.
5. Damage System is fair
hoursPlayed:
8 . class balance feels good.

This game has a lot going for it. BUT


The Bad:
1. Game all too often turns into typcial

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Trying to itch that real world infantry combat on a large scale itch? Tired of glitching around in Arma 3, not knowing if your FPS will plummet the next moment? Then this game is for you. I streamed this game for about 4 hours yesterday and had a blast. Being Early Access, there are a few rough edges here and there but with the quality of AAA games now-a-days this is on par with their full release quality.

Gameplay:

- Until today I had not truly felt what it was like to leave a man behind.

I was playing a medic
date: and we had advanced to a small hill with some buildings on it. The enemy force started an organized counter attack and started pushing up the hill. Our squad leader yelled frantically to PULL BACK NOW! And while I worked away trying to revive my friend
recommended: I had to eventually stand up and run."\n\nThis game has a lot of flavor for such a tried
hoursPlayed: and tried again style of game (Arma 3
voteText: Insurgency

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's highly realistic, one headshot and you're dead. The graphics are amazing but not optmised. The gameplay is heart-racing, adrenline-pumping fun. On the other hand, the game is incomplete and AMD graphics are suffering.

The Development team is highly dedicated to this project, streaming their game development on twitch and keeping their players fully aware of their game's roadmap. As well as growing their team and gaining more talent (providing a higher quality game.)

Other details:
VAC is integrated in the game.

This game is the follow-up to Project Reality, a battlefield 2 and Arma 2 mod.

A team focused game, built around a player/squad-role system.

A game you can go in with no friends, and come out of with 9 new friends.

Beware: This isn't a game where one player can carry their entire team. It requires communication between players (in any form: text chat or voice,) and the ability to give out orders as squad leader or follow orders as a solder.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game feels alot like a newer more graphical intense verison of project reality. with each update the game gets exceptionally better. for a game still in early access it is very playable and very enjoyable. Once this game has vehicles added it will truly be a masterpiece able to compete with the largest titles like Arma 3 and Battlefield. If you are looking to buy a realistic tactical FPS that revolves greatly around teamwork, I would highty recommend this game as you will not be dissapointed especially as more updates are released. The only flaws that i find is how large the maps are without any vehicles making it seem like a walking simulator at times, and the occassional deliberate team kills by teammates.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Absolutely the best Mil-Sim game I've ever played (albeit in alpha) the first 10 hours of the game are the most horrific (full of butthurt) gameplay you think you've ever attempted personally; getting shot from no where, never spotting enemies and simply having no idea wtf you're doing. Learning curve is massive and requires quick learning, quick twich reactions, 100% teamwork/communication and most importantly patience.

I started taking squad lead position about 18 hours in after learning the basics of the game, and watching way too many bad SL's getting their guys wiped out mostly out of reluctant incompetence, It becomes night and day how to play the game when you have a SL that knows wtf they're doing, and actively gives a hoot about their guys getting hit and downed by the enemy.

I find the human interactions at the start of the round pretty awesome, guys talking about random shet that has nothing to do with the task at hand laughing it up full well knowing the poop's about to hit the fan. However when you have a squad of fully commited guys willing to work together as a team, point out enemy bearings, and trust their SL requardless of situation, this game gives off one of the most rewarding feelings when you set it down. Personally I get the feeling as,Yeah
date: we just fuqd shet up for 40 minutes
recommended: lets do that again."\n\nNow is it worth $40? I can see where people wouldn't say yes
hoursPlayed: "It's an alpha game with a singular gameplay
voteText: optimized like crap
helpfulPercent: just another take on BF4 conquest" In all reality it's worth full sticker price of a finished game. Looks beautiful
votesHelpful: realistic
votesTotal: (for a video game) controls are simple yet precise
votesFunny:
and gameplay that's extremely stressful and addictive. The regulars playing the game atm take this game as hardcore as I've seen gaming get. You really need to play the game to understand how special this game is. I highly suggest this game to any honest hardcore FPS gamers who are itching for the next big thing. Give the game a dozen hours and honestly tell me I'm dead wrong.

*TO THE DEVS*
Don't fuq this game up
commentsCount: you have created something truly special to the genre here and I'm sure there's already thousands of dedicated fans backing the growth and production of this game in the coming years. Don't become the next Day-Z toss-up."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Alright, here is the story of my first game:

I start up Squad, giddy als all hell to get going. I was really interested in getting this game for a while already, the moment was finally there!

I join a server, as well as a decent looking squad with 2 clan members. I was nervous as a bag of d1cks because all kinds of things were still very unknown to me; how are the people in the community in a random round in a random squad, can I pull my own weight, do I know enough already about the game to really benefit my squad and the team?

Turns out I really did not have to worry. I silently linked up with the squad leader after spawning in and basically just followed him and the rest of the squad around, moving from position to position, giving covering fire, keeping an eye out for contacts and so on. All the while getting more and more in communication with the various helpful, kind and cool deviants from the squad.

My confidence about my capability's was starting to grow and mayng, was I going to need it.

Our squad was the one who had to capture and defend the ruins that is Castle. We spread out accordingly and even set up a support detachment on the ridge next to castle so we'd have a lot more sightlines on the place and some great covering fire. Slowly but surely enemies started to appear and trickle in. I was perched in one of the higher structures in Castle so I had good vision over the place as well as some good cover from the direction we knew the enemies were coming from. And massively attack they finally did, with multiple squads.

It was complete carnage in the castle. Thrilling, adrenaline pumping, PTSD inducing close quarters combat. For at least 10 minutes, it was insane. Bullets flying around all over the place, grenades going off everywhere. Slowly but surely our numbers were dwindling giving out loud screams wherever they fell. Nonetheless, we were making it incredibly hard for the enemy to push up and set up an effective position. Our medics risked everything to just, try and keep as many as they could alive.

The supporting fire from the ridge made it so the enemy couldn't really push on my position and I in turn was able to make it very hard for them to find good cover to do anything with. They were pinned in castle. This did not stop them from flanking attacks, using smoke to move in cover, using the little bits of cover they had left as best they could to fire back at us. They were giving it everything to get Castle.

After spending almost all of the ammunition in my weapons, sweating like a pig and shaking from the adrenaline, we had won! The enemy team ran out of tickets because of the ferocity of the fighting in that round, as well as our succesfull attempt to defend Castle.

I sat back in my chair in awe, feeling spent because of this first round. I was actually the top player on the server on points by far since I was defending from inside the capzone, and our squad was the top squad. My kd was only 5-2, definitly not the most kills in my squad, but my role in being there on that little perch in that godforsaken castle was (at least it really felt and looked like it) crucial. And that was fckn amazing.

So, I can truly recommend this game already in it's alpha state. I played a couple of other rounds after that on different servers and had similar experiences each time.

The immersion is great, the people are pretty dang cool, strategy and communication completely win games and that is so incredibly satisfying to experience and play with. The graphics are pretty good as well I must say, the sounds are awesome.

I'm really looking forward to all the updates and how this game is going to develop. There's still a lot of things that aren't fully fleshed out or functioning, but from what I've seen the developers are doing an awesome job updating it. The game itself is really stable for me but if you're an AMD user, wait till they've fixed the problems with it.

It's like a huge complicated chessgame, you can chose the role you play and how you go about defeating the enemy with your squad and team. It's completely up to you. If you even remotely love anything that comes closes to that, Squad will probably be a great thing to add to your life.

Love it!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First of all, this is a great game!

Despite this, I don't think I'll touch it again until I find a suitable group or clan for it. I'm still going to recommend it, because that's not the developer's fault. I play this game for the teamwork and cooperation, and you often find good people, many of whom I've added on Steam. Unfortunately, the bad ruins the experience for me completely; and after playing with a group in ARMA 3 and in Mount and Blade, I don't think I can handle some of the negative nature of public servers. This isn't the game developer's fault in any way, but it's just how it is when things go mainstream.

Ever since this game came out on Steam, the community has seen a steady drop in etiquette and behavior. More and more, I see players lashing out at the squad leader angrily for not putting down a rally point when they physically can't. A lot of it has to do with young, immature teenagers. While I've met mature ones, most of them fall under the stereotype of angry Call of Duty players. If you can stomach it after gaming for several hours, great. If not, find a group or avoid it.

My confidence about my capability's was starting to grow and mayng, was I going to need it.

Our squad was the one who had to capture and defend the ruins that is Castle. We spread out accordingly and even set up a support detachment on the ridge next to castle so we'd have a lot more sightlines on the place and some great covering fire. Slowly but surely enemies started to appear and trickle in. I was perched in one of the higher structures in Castle so I had good vision over the place as well as some good cover from the direction we knew the enemies were coming from. And massively attack they finally did, with multiple squads.

It was complete carnage in the castle. Thrilling, adrenaline pumping, PTSD inducing close quarters combat. For at least 10 minutes, it was insane. Bullets flying around all over the place, grenades going off everywhere. Slowly but surely our numbers were dwindling giving out loud screams wherever they fell. Nonetheless, we were making it incredibly hard for the enemy to push up and set up an effective position. Our medics risked everything to just, try and keep as many as they could alive.

The supporting fire from the ridge made it so the enemy couldn't really push on my position and I in turn was able to make it very hard for them to find good cover to do anything with. They were pinned in castle. This did not stop them from flanking attacks, using smoke to move in cover, using the little bits of cover they had left as best they could to fire back at us. They were giving it everything to get Castle.

After spending almost all of the ammunition in my weapons, sweating like a pig and shaking from the adrenaline, we had won! The enemy team ran out of tickets because of the ferocity of the fighting in that round, as well as our succesfull attempt to defend Castle.

I sat back in my chair in awe, feeling spent because of this first round. I was actually the top player on the server on points by far since I was defending from inside the capzone, and our squad was the top squad. My kd was only 5-2, definitly not the most kills in my squad, but my role in being there on that little perch in that godforsaken castle was (at least it really felt and looked like it) crucial. And that was fckn amazing.

So, I can truly recommend this game already in it's alpha state. I played a couple of other rounds after that on different servers and had similar experiences each time.

The immersion is great, the people are pretty dang cool, strategy and communication completely win games and that is so incredibly satisfying to experience and play with. The graphics are pretty good as well I must say, the sounds are awesome.

I'm really looking forward to all the updates and how this game is going to develop. There's still a lot of things that aren't fully fleshed out or functioning, but from what I've seen the developers are doing an awesome job updating it. The game itself is really stable for me but if you're an AMD user, wait till they've fixed the problems with it.

It's like a huge complicated chessgame, you can chose the role you play and how you go about defeating the enemy with your squad and team. It's completely up to you. If you even remotely love anything that comes closes to that, Squad will probably be a great thing to add to your life.

Love it!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game might be early access, but it is the BEST tactical shooter I've ever played.
Take all of the best aspects and pacing from games like Insurgency and Battlefield and combine them with a sense of scale like the ARMA series - that is Squad. Hardcore and unforgiving firefights, with team ability to build forward rally points and bases -- reinforce existing compounds with sandbags and ammo caches. Medics that can pick up and heal downed and wounded players -- support units bring machinegun suppression and grenade and rocket launchers to dominate dug in enemies.

I wasn't expecting this game to be this good, especially not in such an early stage of development. With only room to grow and improve, and an active player base - Squad is the game to keep an eye on.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First of all, this is a great game!

Despite this, I don't think I'll touch it again until I find a suitable group or clan for it. I'm still going to recommend it, because that's not the developer's fault. I play this game for the teamwork and cooperation, and you often find good people, many of whom I've added on Steam. Unfortunately, the bad ruins the experience for me completely; and after playing with a group in ARMA 3 and in Mount and Blade, I don't think I can handle some of the negative nature of public servers. This isn't the game developer's fault in any way, but it's just how it is when things go mainstream.

Ever since this game came out on Steam, the community has seen a steady drop in etiquette and behavior. More and more, I see players lashing out at the squad leader angrily for not putting down a rally point when they physically can't. A lot of it has to do with young, immature teenagers. While I've met mature ones, most of them fall under the stereotype of angry Call of Duty players. If you can stomach it after gaming for several hours, great. If not, find a group or avoid it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

SQUAD fills a much needed gap between games like ARMA and Battlefield. It draws on it's roots of BF2 with a focused MP experience unlike ARMA but much more challanging and deep than any recent Battlefield game. The maps all have a good feel to them, offering varying experiences and don't get old. The sound is top notch and probably the best in any game I've heard, the eary sound of a long off fire fight the time it take sound to travel and the crack of a bullet that makes you jump out of your seat, the audio is damn close to the real deal as you can get with out setting foot onto a range. The visual effects are beautiful and well thought out, the lingering dust that's been kicked up from a rocket or grenade making the desert maps feel dry and dirty or a tracer flying over head or pointing out a potential threat.

Even in it's earliest stages, SQUAD has been well worth the price and is getting better with every update that has been released.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Intro

Had my eye on this game for a while now watching other streamers and friends rubbing this game around my steams friends list. I broke down and got it finally =P. I know the price is high, but wow I havnt had this much fun in a while playing a FPS like this. I'm enjoying this game tons! This is coming from someone who has play 1000's of hours of CS:go, BF4, Arma2: OA - takistan mod, and Arma 3 takistan and ton other mods... life, wasteland, battle royale, KoTH. You get the drift.....

Pros-
-The Very Best VOIP system and voice quality in any FPS. Yah beats out CS:go and makes Arma 3 voip sound like a joke.(No more need for teamspeak nazis demanding you to join their teamspeak or they kick you to clearly hear them, LOL!)
-Awesome gun visual & sounds. Explosion effects really are NICE.
-Squad members really have been communicating a lot in game which makes it really intense during tense moments.
-UE4 engine implemented well and looks really good and runs smooth. 35-40 fps on my old quad with 770 gtx on high settings.
-Various maps with realistic layouts.
-Not a shity sniper fest! =) 4x Asoc optics limited to 2 per team.
-Squad leader can build bases! and fellow squad members can help build up placed objects.

Cons-
-My screen has been flashing black for a millisecond  when I first sight in or fire my gun after respawning.
-No teamfire regulation yet. =( Teamkillers... ♥♥♥♥ YOU learn to use your M key to see whos in front of you first.
-No 50 v 50 yet.
-Hard to tell Russian vs American troop skins in some maps, making more undesired TK's.
-USA servers are limited and hard to get into right now.

Solutions that would help Squad. (More will be added as I test this game out)

They should make the map not take up your whole screen when viewing it. Maybe make it like Arma's GPS setup, where the map is just in one corner and can be viewed while engaged in combat. This will be better because you can view other teamates location very easily before just blasting anything that moves.

My Conlusion of Squad

Overall I give this game a 9.5 out of 10. I know this game is only around 1 month old and Early access and I'm still very impressed. I recommend this game completely and would love to see more USA servers out! This game defently has lots of potential and will be very interesting to see the implication vehicles have on Squads overall gameplay value.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is an alpha and has the most perfectly directed content for its current stage. It's currently its OWN game already. The amount bugs I've seen is how much you can count on one hand, if not less. Doesn't affect gameplay at all.

No crashes. Slight server lag accross all servers  in terms of ping. but they'll fix that. I have only seen 1 spike in my 7.6 hours of gameplay currently. Lasted 3 seconds and all was well.

Game runs like a dream on my computer, though my computer is pulling high frames through brute force.
(Gtx 980 Ti, 6700k @ 4.6ghz)

My favorite part of the game is the sound design. Gun shots are so loud and so accurate that they can hurt your ears. (Of course I turn it down) but they're SO ACCURATE. M4 sounds exactly like a 5.56 in real life. Has that sharp crack to it, pure perfection.

The game is more CPU oriented, looking at the sky or ground doesn't gain or loose any frames my FPS sits around 66 without vsync.

I'm a diehard PR fan from BF2, way before its release when I was younger. This is a dream. Once the vehicles get here it's going to be amazing.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have over 2000 hours over 7 years in Project Reality, The mod this is based on.

The game isn't yet playable" in the competitive sense. Anyone who tells you otherwise is the usual ignorant fanboy who will try to protect the game from anything. There are plenty of placeholder mechanics that are simply overpowered and make no sense at all
date: but do have proper mechanics on paper and in the making. Its still an early Alpha. If you don't mind waiting
recommended:
then skip this part.

For example: a Firebase (Spawn Point) can be built literally anywhere without any effort. Press T next to a couple of guys from your squad and you have unlimited spawns and regenrating ammo at that location. Having infinite ammo also allows you to constantly shoot rockets and lob grenades. (The proper mechanic in the making is a logistic system close to what Project Reality had - Logistic trucks. You would need to drive and defend loud defenseless truck to get a firebase up or rearm it with ammo or spawns.)

There are also some issues with Firebases not being overrun when you're next to them and you may end up getting 30+ kills from spawn camping it
hoursPlayed: because you can't shovel it down when they keep spawnning

and they're going to keep spawnning because Firebases at the moment have unlimited logistics (Ammo and Spawns).

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nVery very very immersive game, really loving it so far, it's a mix of Arma and Battlefield, but it feels like it's own thing. Sound system is amazing. Medic system is very simple and works extremely well, build system is very well integrated and works awesome, and the maps and environments are insanely awesome. It easily takes the best out of both games and runs with it and wins the race by far. The only problem so far is bad FPS dips, I run at around ~30 fps, but it dips every 3 seconds down to 15 and back to 30 which is causing my screen to jerk, and in firefights it does it a lot and causes me to die most of the time, but overall, I am enjoying the hell out of this title and it's only in Alpha, once they get the FPS problems fixed then it's gonna be perfect!! Right now I would give it probably a good 7.5 out of ten because the FPS issue does take a lot out of the game because it is an FPS afterall, but still a good buy for an Early Access game and very enjoyable!!!!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Coming from lots of hours of both Project Reality and Arma, I enjoy this game very, very much.

The gameplay so far is amazing, and there's only more to come. I love the gunplay, it feels very good to shoot the different guns ingame. It's easy to get in to, even though it has a lot to offer.

The developers are working very closely with the community, and it is great to see that in a market full of unfinished and abandoned Early Access games. Many of the developers are coming from the Project Reality mod, and they know gaming, they know how important communication, and later on modding, is for a game to live on for many years.

I recommend this game for those who like PR, Arma, or just want to get in to a more tactical game rather than Battlefield or Insurgency. Some might need to hold off though because of performance issues on some rigs, and the fact that the game does not have all the content yet.

But for me, this is the game. THE game.

This is not a full review, but I wanted to share some of my thoughts so far on Squad, and in the future I'll hopefully update this review to fit the progress of the game.

recommended:
then skip this part.

For example: a Firebase (Spawn Point) can be built literally anywhere without any effort. Press T next to a couple of guys from your squad and you have unlimited spawns and regenrating ammo at that location. You would need to drive and defend loud defenseless truck to get a firebase up or rearm it with ammo or spawns.)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I had never heard of this game until the day it released on steam, I'm certainly glad I finally did. For a game in its alpha stage and so few devs I'm amazed at the level this game is at. I even played against the founder in a match last night.

The game is a mix between arma and battlefield with an emphasis on team work, making it a very fun and immersive experience. It does however need some tweaks on some bugs and optimization, but that's something to be expected buying an early access game. Overall Ive already recommended this game to a few friends and look forward to see what else comes from the game.
voteText: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is an alpha and has the most perfectly directed content for its current stage. It's currently its OWN game already. The amount bugs I've seen is how much you can count on one hand, if not less. Doesn't affect gameplay at all.

No crashes. Slight server lag accross all servers  in terms of ping. but they'll fix that. I have only seen 1 spike in my 7.6 hours of gameplay currently. Lasted 3 seconds and all was well.

Game runs like a dream on my computer, though my computer is pulling high frames through brute force.
(Gtx 980 Ti, 6700k @ 4.6ghz)

My favorite part of the game is the sound design. Gun shots are so loud and so accurate that they can hurt your ears. (Of course I turn it down) but they're SO ACCURATE. M4 sounds exactly like a 5.56 in real life. Has that sharp crack to it, pure perfection.

The game is more CPU oriented, looking at the sky or ground doesn't gain or loose any frames my FPS sits around 66 without vsync.

I'm a diehard PR fan from BF2, way before its release when I was younger. This is a dream. Once the vehicles get here it's going to be amazing.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The guys behind Project Reality have made a masterpiece!

That being said, I will try to be objective in my review of this game.

I originally bought the game a while back, in part to show my support to the development of the game, and in part because I was to excited to see what the game offered. Fearing I was going to be let somewhat down, I started the game up for its first run.

I was not let down. My initial thought was, and still is, that it's a sort of mix between Insurgency and the Arma series. I think in a lot of ways, the game will address itself to both groups of players.
It has the simple controls and management of Insurgency, but at the same time offers combined arma warfare in a scale similar to Arma, not to mention that the maps are quite large, and the different fireteam roles actually matter in this game.
The ability to set up outposts as spawnpoints, and the need for a tactical plan, is something that appeals to me in this game. While some might feel the urge to go Rambo in the game, you could say that there is no room within fireteam for such actions. Fireteam tactics and coop play are a priority when playing this game.

The game has quite good graphics, and will appeal to those looking for something more serious than COD of BF, but without losing the simple control scheme. The game also offers in-game VoIP, letting you utilize three different radio channels, one for direct chat, one for fireteam chat, and one for company chat.

All in all this is a game I look forward to playing a lot more, and also seeing what the future has in store for. I highly recommend this game if you like playing Insurgency, but maybe want a little more realism, or if you're an Arma player looking for a similar experience, but without the Arma problems. (If you're an Arma player, you'll know what I mean).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've played this since the pre-alpha tests, and i've seen this game being developed from scratch to what we have right now. And knowing their plans in the future, seeing the monthly progress updates, i can say that this game could even be worth 100 Euros/Dollars/GBP once it is finished.

The teamwork isn't up to par yet with my experiences from Project Reality, but that is to be expected with at least half the players being kind of, or completely new to this type of gameplay.

No vehicles yet, but i didn't expect there to be any, considering they had to be coded from scratch, in a new game engine that doesn't really have that much ground yet to stand on.

The gunplay is solid, and firefights are absolutely chaotic, and fun.

This is an alpha, which should be pretty clear to people who were not told in advance. There are glitches and bugs and unfinished things, which is to be expected. But so far, this alpha is already better than alot of beta's that i've experienced, or released games.


For the old veterans i do have a request, don't get angry with the new players who don't know what to do yet, but instead teach them how stuff gets done! Take the role of Squad leader and help the newbies with understanding the game better, that way not only the game, but community itself will only improve alot in the future.

My final verdict for Squad so far is a solid 10/10!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Played the non-steam version a lot.

This is the only tactical game that let's you just join a random server and have fun with tons of strangers who are actually kind of coordinated. You don't need a group of friends or a clan to enjoy this game. Almost everybody uses a mic, or at least the squad leader does so he can tell his squad what to do. This is not Battlefield, this is not for lone wolfs. This game is about teamwork and objectives, not about your kill/death ratio.

The gunplay reminds me of Insurgency, the map size is similar to huge Battlefield maps but the gameplay itself is unique. It feels like Battlefield 2 with more teamwork. There will be vehicles pretty soon, there are different game modes, classes and weapons coupled with various factions.

The devs are awesome, most (all?) of them come from the modding scene. They listen to the community and work together with them, talk to everybody on the forums and reddit. This will be another one of these rare Early Access done right" games - in fact it is
date: because I've been playing the pre-alpha since spring 2015 and the pace at which the devs release new stuff is fantastic.\n\nThe core game right now is fun. It is not complete but you can certainly get a few hundred hours of enjoyment out of it in its current state. No match plays the same
recommended: it is simply fantastic.\n\nThe performance is good. It is not really optimized yet but I get steady 60fps with a single gtx970 on highest settings. Also the game craps out when there are ~100 people in a server

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Played the non-steam version a lot.

This is the only tactical game that let's you just join a random server and have fun with tons of strangers who are actually kind of coordinated. You don't need a group of friends or a clan to enjoy this game. Almost everybody uses a mic, or at least the squad leader does so he can tell his squad what to do. This is not Battlefield, this is not for lone wolfs. This game is about teamwork and objectives, not about your kill/death ratio.

The gunplay reminds me of Insurgency, the map size is similar to huge Battlefield maps but the gameplay itself is unique. It feels like Battlefield 2 with more teamwork. There will be vehicles pretty soon, there are different game modes, classes and weapons coupled with various factions.

The devs are awesome, most (all?) of them come from the modding scene. They listen to the community and work together with them, talk to everybody on the forums and reddit. This will be another one of these rare Early Access done right" games - in fact it is
