reviewText:
Early Access Review

Squad or as others may know it by The spirtual succesor to the Project Reality mod for battlefield 2."
Is a great standalone installment to the project reality formula made by many of the same devs that worked on the mod
date: \n\nSquad is a great return to the genre of Tactical shooters
recommended: it promotes and relies heavily on teamwork and communication and working with your team in Squads hence the name.\n\nNow what separates this game to other tactical/milsim shooters you might ask?   Well first of all Squad is a very easily accesible game
hoursPlayed: unlike other shooters like ARMA for example
voteText: where if you want to get around 60-100 players in a good scenario mission and then also be coordinated and communicate with something like ACRE or Task force radio mods  you almost always have to be in a milsim community and schedule events for such things to get that experience.\nBut with Squad all you have to do is just join up on any offical or community ran public server with good admin moderation
helpfulPercent: to get that experience since the gamemodes and mechanics in Squad are all very well made to kinda force that kind of gameplay and interaction with other from the get go
votesHelpful: (Built in Local voip and radio channels through built in mumble to the game) ( Very harsh penalties to getting shot and dying) (Almost all objectives require more people too accomplish/capture) if you start running around and trying to lonewolf you will not have a very good time and most likely die very much and not accomplish anything good for the team.\n\nNow Squad isnt exactly a milsim shooter
votesTotal: but it tries to bridge the gap between a pretty realistic military shooter and still a fairly simple game in terms of understanding and controls and it wont sacrifice any good gameplay just too add in something that would be more realistic
votesFunny: it still wants to be a fun game to play in the core
commentsCount: It wants to be both realstic and fun at the same time!\n\nThe current main gamemodes in Squad are Insurgency and AAS
column16: which if you have played PR previously you are probably pretty familiar with them
column17: In AAS you have to capture flags in a specific order
column18: and which locations are also dynamically set after each start of the round
column19: and the amount of flags that are in play may also be just one are several
column20: and in AAS theres also always one flag that you have to defend or attack. which creates some really unqiue and interesting gameplay.\n\nIn Insurgency the goal for blufor is to find enemy weapon caches that are unmarked on the map until you gain enough intelligence by killing/interrogating enemies/civilians  the latter which was part of PR but not currently introduced in Squad
column21: The first Cache intel however is given to you after a few minutes at the start of the round
column22: but the rest of them you have to gain intel for or just find them yourself by searching the map and looking for enemy activity
column23: after a certain amount of caches have been destroyed blufor wins
column24: and opfor needs to defend them all and deplete the blufors reinforcement tickets
column25: however  Insurgents dont have any tickets.\n\nTheres also some new and smaller modes like Conquest and one more at least that I cant remember right now
column26: but they are not as polished or popular currently.\n\nThe maps are all pretty big
column28: the locations of them will also vary a lot
column29: currently we have some maps set in eastern europe and afghanistan but in the future we will also see urban maps like the one thats currently being remade from PR Fallujah West one very popular urban map set in Iraq
column30: and the current size of them are between 1 square km to 4 km Which PR had about the same sizes
column31: but I think they have been thinking about making maps even up to 16 square kms in size once the next thing im most excited for with this game gets introduced.\n\nYes VEHICLES!  Vehicles of all sorts will make their introduction in the future
column32: everything from  ground transport humvees/technicals to apcs
column33: tanks and helicopters. And as youd expect you will need to have several crewmen in them to operate them
column34: you will not just be able to solo a tank or APC
column35: This is not battlefield!\n\nOne of the coolest and most unique features in Squad has to be the FOB building system (FOB is one of the 3 types of spawn points in Squad) while it was in PR it was just very basic then
column36: now in Squad you can make huge  bases for your FOB's  or make them as tiny as you want
column37: as the basebuilding is very easy to do
column38: currently the requirements to place down a FOB radio is only to have a couple of teammates by your side and to not be too close too another FOB
column39: but in the future you will have to establish supply routers with  Logistic Trucks and Helicopters that have to come and deliver supplies before you can build up your FOB
column40: and you will also need additional supplies to upgrade it even more and  too keep it up and running.\n\nBesides FOB's you can spawn on Squad Leader dropped Rally points
column41: which also require some of your squad mates near to be able to be dropped
column42: it also only has a certain amount of respawns
column43: and if enemies get too near to a rally point they will disappear.\n\nThe 3RD type of spawnpoint is your Mainbase which will probably get seen more used in the future once things like Helicopters are introduced
column44: where you will be able to jump in and get your transport back to the battlefield that way.\n\nNow lets talk about roles and kits
column45: The kit selection system works in the way that once you are a part of a squad and the bigger that squad gets
column46: more kits and roles (classes)  get avaible for  you and your squad to pick from
column47: altough most kits also have certain  limits to them
column48: like for example you can only have 2 medics in a full 8 man Squad
column49: same with AR's Same with LAT's  but if we were only example  just 4 people in a squad
column50: we would only be able to have 1 medic etc. This is just another way to promote playing in a squad and with your squad
column51: and aslo for realism and balance reasons certain kits are limited.\n\nNow I could go and on and keep talking about the features and mechanics of this game
column52: but nobody wants too read tha many pages right? ;)  So im gonna stop it here
column53: I think I touched on the most important parts of the game.\n\nBut all in all Squad is a very great tactical shooter with a focus on teamwork and communication that will just get better with time
column54: and that I can also see lasting a very long time thanks to the everlasting and growing PR community
column55: and now with us being on steam it's probably only gonna get better :)"

Clap Clap Clap!!

This game rocks!

Good job by the devs, not that i had any doubt, i loved bf2, i loved even more PR but this is amazing...tense, immersive, unforgiving but when you play with the right people it becomes exalting!

The game play is fluid and quick, i have to say that i prefer this gunplay then arma 3 which i find more clunky than this.
Graphics, well, i don't mind so much in the first place, it's alpha  and you can't demand stunning stuff yet.
Gun hits feels immediate, i was playing with some british guys and my ping was around 140 yet i wasn't feeling any lag at all. Explotions are devastating, the blast radius is perfect, you don't want to be near it.

it's a 9 over 10 for the moment.

Keep it up devs! Love it!

Wow, so I go to my pc and load it up with my surround sound headset, cranked the graphics and join a game. It was almost like they took a image out of my head of a terrain layout. But it is still unfinished and I hope to purchase this game again when im am more ready and be able to dive back in soon.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The devs. are lying because its not actually alpha. It was a great game upon launch and what was & is promised to be added in future development does not detract from the games playablity what so ever. Ive seen more bugs and glitches in final release games backed by major brand name studios. The gameplay is smooth and fluid, the gun play is not clunky, it feels acurate and responsive. No issues with shots registering. Very good graphics for such large maps and so much going on. The most intially complete alpha i've ever purchased and recently they release updates with working machine gun emplacements and overhauled the game to make adding vehicles possible in future releases. I've been told by AMD users the lastest update even allows them to play with less performace issues. Even hot patchs hours after major updates to address issues.  The devs are serious about this game.

Probably the most difficult but rewarding gameplay i've had since actual project reality. I immensily enjoy actual combat. That being said the toughtest part is the entire game revolves around teamwork. If you don't have a mic or dont speak basic english, this game might not be for you. To be on the winning team not only does your squad of up to 9 people have to communicate and work together to cover fire, move and flank, address injured players, build bases and rallys but your squad leader must work with other squad leaders to coordinate attacks and their defense.

The community seems to fluctuate but lately more and more people seem to talk and play together. I've had a bunch of really close games full of long and intense fire fights. The game is everything you could hope for in a tactical shooter/open battlefield game. Its the players that can make or break the experince. Read some guides before buying if you want to know what to expect and what is expected of you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Squad tries to be as realistic of a shooter as possible. You can place Forward Operation Bases where you can respawn on and then place defense down as you see fit. You can place ladders to shoot over walls, place down sandbags, or even small bunkers.

The community is really nice as well. I have been playing for 1 hour on a server and everybody was really helpfull.
If you are really into realistic games and shooters than i definitely recommend you to check it out. This definitely is a must have if you are a fan of ArmA, as it comes really close to it but in Squad the maps are smaller which makes the game more action-packed.
voteText: 6 of 11 people (55%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So far I have found nothing that would be excused by it being an Alpha. The game shows a lot of improvements on most of the competing games. I has a larger map and supports more players than insurgency, it runs when it has a lot of players, unlike ArmA, and looks better graphically than Project Reality.

Squad is a game created so those who want a hardcore military sim can play without a $3000 computer. The amount of teamwork in the public servers matches that of loose clans, you wont find people who understand everything and follow the chain of command to a T, but you will find those willing to work together towards a common goal. I backed this game sight unseen, and was rewarded ten-fold when I played it at PAX and got to talk to the Developers first-hand. I won't say this is a game for everyone however, the difficulty curve is relatively high and if you are not already accustomed to games like Insurgency, ArmA and Red Orchestra, I would say to look into it a bit more and see if you are really ready to be shot a kilometer away from a sniper providing overwatch.

I really enjoyed Project Reality and from what I can tell, this game meets everything I need in a modern tactical shooter.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm an old veteran of Project Reality, which is what this game is based upon, and a Founder for Squad, and I've clocked much more time on the game then what my profile says, and heres my pros and cons review.

PRO'S

+Pulse Raising Combat
+Amazing Immersive Sounds
+Tactical Battles and Encounters
+Super Dedicated and Talented Developers from Project Reality (BF2 Mod)
+Great Communication and Teamwork/Team Spirit.

You will not find a better shooter until, if, they ever decide to make another game.

CON'S - Which are very few considering it's an Alpha build.

-Currently lacking mechanical combat.
-Lacking additional base building.
-Lacking availability of becoming a Team's Commander (If this will ever be a feature, I don't know.)
-Could do with some additional performance tweaks(HOWEVER! Performance has been GREATLY increased with Alpha Patch 3.0, and I have been able to run the game steady at 60 fps on a 80 player server.)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has some promise, but it's going to be in a distant future.

If you already have Arma 2 (Overwatch/Epoch) and Arma 3.  Then this game will just be a waste of 40$ for you.  It's pretty much the same thing, but in a currently worse state (Early Access, remember that.)

There are several issues with the game itself running too as well that the devs are aware of and aren't currently fixable.  Luckily steam refund will have you covered on that if it does happen.

Weapon selection is bare bones, people will trap you in a base somewhere usually, this is a game you almost must play with friends.  For some reason your guy puts his weapon to safe when putting away a weapon which is a joke.  Have these guys ever been in a deployed enviroment?  You never put any of your guns on safe when you're out on patrol or in an active warzone with enemies all around you.   *swap to pistol, puts M4 on safe and puts away, brings out pistol, disengages safe, ready to fire, you're already dead*

Tool animations are way to long, IE: throwing grenades, smokes, weapon transitions, reloads.
US side are supposed to be trained warriors, yet they aren't.  Just as bad as the middle eastern side.

Other side though, the graphics are great, it feels fluid and as I said above, shows promise in the distant future.


I do not recommend this game in it's current state.  I have already refunded it.  Overly hyped.  Arma 2 with all DLC is way cheaper (plus on ♥♥♥) and has a huge modding community.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThere are a lot of prior military gamers out there, my self included. Served in the marines, was stationed with 1/3 in Hawaii, and deployed twice to Afghanistan. That said, this is the only game, and I mean the only game, that will put you in the shoes of someone in the middle of a fire fight. I've been in a TIC (troops in contact) for 10 hours, and this is the only game that almost mimics that experience, and its awesome. This game is a far better simulator than any other military shooter on the market.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is the best game around.

Been playing since Closed Alpha and have been on it nearly every night.

Looking for teamwork? Communication? Challenges? The most instense firefights found in a game? This is for you.

This game relies heavily on teamwork and communication, and when these two are done right, prepare yourselves for addiction and withdrawl.
A few issues regarding server crashes and not being optimised needs to be understood, given the stage this game is at. Aside from these, this is the cleanest, most polished alpha/early access I have played.

Please don't buy this game if you're expecting a Call of Duty or even Battlefield experience. This is in a league of its own (aside from BF2: Project Reality) in both variety and depth compared to games that are out today. This is down to how every round is different.

The dev's know what they're doing. They play the game with the community, they talk to us in the forums. They are the most active and involved development team I have come across.

I literally cannot praise this game enough. I haven't played anything else since I got into closed alpha back in September, and I have been on it nearly every night, as I said before.

Every round is different from the last, the firefights are epic and the community are a buzz.

You would not regret buying this game.

11/10

Best game I have ever played - and it's only in Alpha

reviewText:
Early Access Review


اللعبة مازلت تحتاج الكثير من العمل والمود الحالي المتعمد هو مود الإحتلال يختلف عن باتلفيلد في انه لابد من إحتلال المناطق بشكل تدريجي وإلزامي
اللعبة لازم تمشي مع السكواد وفي نفس الوقت حاول اذا كنت ميت تنتظر الميدك ولا تسوي ريسباون عشان ما تخسر سكوادك نقاط الريسباون
في نوعين من الشات الصوتي مع سكوادك وكمان مع القريب منك فإبمكانك تطلب الدعم بشكل أسرع وأسهل
اللعبة الجري فيها محسوب عليك وفر في مناطق حتى تقدر تجري في مناطق

عيبها الوحيد واللي يجبرك انك تتقاعس عن تجربتها مرة اخرى هو انك فعلا تحتاج شلة شباب من اصدقائك في تيم سبيك او غيره حتى يكون التفاعل والإداء اكثر
عادة لو دخلت اللعبة التيم ورك مطلوب وراح تلتزم فيه وستجد الكل ملتزم فيه وتحصل سكواد يمشون مع بعض وإذا جاك ضرر تحصل الميدك مباشرة يجيك ويعطيك الإسعافات

الإشتباكات في اللعبه كثيرة من حولك لكن بالنسبه لك تجدها قليله لا تسوي ذيب وتقول بيدور من وراهم لو حتى نجحت وقتلت واحد انت كذا حجرت نفسك صرت لوحدك والدعم بعيد منك
الكلام عنها طويل وفي أشياء ما ذكرتها واختصرها لك بشكل سريع

*لابد تكون رايق
*تحركاتك للمنطقه لابد تكون مخطط لها
*إذا اعجبتك انسيرجنسي هذه راح تعجبك لانها مثلها ولكن بشكل اكبر
*اللعبة مازلت تحتاج الكثير من العمل

نعم تستحق التجربه اذا كنت من محبين بروجكت ريالتي او انسيرجنسي

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have been involved in the testing and promotion of Squad for something close to 8 months now. Seeing this game grow and develop has been a pleasure to be a part of.

For me it's easy to see how far this game has come, and where it is going. For you out there that don't know what this game is, and if you should get it, then I only have a few things to say to you.

- If you like the idea of huge maps where you can engage players literally a mile away, this games for you.

- If you like the idea of propper combined vehicle and infantry assaults on compounds, this game is for you.

- If you like Asymetric warfare, using tactics and teamwork to outsmart your enamy and fortafying and holding positions, this game is for you.

- If you like Nation vs Nation combat, including Tanks going toe to toe alongside comparable infantry and air assets, this game is for you.

- If you like fastroping into a compound from a chopper and taking the enamy by surprise. Why havent you got the game yet... This game is for you.

As a few last words, I'd like to point out that this game is the quality of some other games that have been in early access for a good 6 months. Not to disrespect other games, but you can only expect great things from this title, and performance, graphics and the features list will only continue to improve with the time and support of fans!

Oh, and just wait for the mods to roll in, WW2 mod anyone ;)

Some specs of my rig: i5 3570, GTX 970, 16GB 1600MHz RAM. Internet: 32 Mbit DSL.

Refunded and rather waiting for release. Never doing the same fault again like I did with Dayz (which got unsatisfying performance, too).

Can't recommend in this state because, for example, 50 vs. 50 matches are advertised but are for most players rather unplayable.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As a fan of the old Battlefield games, I see a lot of promise in Squad. Once more maps, vehicles and more weapons etc. are added, I think this will (at some point in the future) be an excellent game. However, at this early Alpha stage, there simply isn't enough content to justify the $40 price tag.

I look forward to recommending this game when more content is added, but as it stands, there simply isn't enough content to keep me interested.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nCan't recomend this game yet. It is poorly optimized, I think Dayz has better optimization. The game lacks in content like no vehicles and a couple of  buildings on larger maps. And squad leaders can be jerks sometimes, I would like for them to implement a system to where the people in the squad of 4 or more can vote kick the squad leader out of the group. It's not worth $40 bucks at all. But the game is still a hell of a lot of fun, but the price and lack of content drives to to say Don't buy it yet.""
